venue.name: SJCC
venue.description:
The San Jose McEnery Convention Center sits in the center of Downtown and boasts hundreds of varied events a year. It has been the home for the OCP Global Summit for over 8 years! The 550,000-square-foot facility is the largest convention center in Silicon Valley. It is named after Tom McEnery, a former Mayor of San Jose. The interactive public art installation "Idea Tree" stands at the front of the Center. 

San Jose is the first convention center in Northern California to receive the cleaning industry’s only outbreak prevention, response and recovery accreditation. Global Biorisk Advisory Council (GBAC) STAR establishes protocols and procedures, offers expert-led training and assesses a facility’s preparedness for biorisk situations. Every venue that receives the accreditation is vetted by GBAC as meeting all requirements for a safe, preventative, and responsive meetings facility.

title: Symposium
description:
The objective of the OCP Future Technologies Symposium is to bring to the OCP Community a forward-looking funnel of technologies which focus on solving future problems facing the industry, and accelerate productization through partnerships and open source R&D. Also, it is a unique opportunity to expose a generation of up-and-coming, best-in-class students to the professional community for purposes of research, training and recruitment. The Global academic, startup and venture communities are invited to participate, as well as industrial organizations performing cutting-edge research related to data center technologies.

Click Here to go to the Future Technologies Symposium page and view the posters.

speakers.title: Vice President and Senior Principal Engineer, Hyperscale Strategy and Execution
speakers.bio: Rebecca leads the organization that influences every aspect of Intel’s cloud platform solutions. Together they shape Intel’s development, production, and business strategy for Hyperscale Cloud Service Providers by driving strategic collaborations with key partners to ensure platform requirements meet customer needs. Rebecca is an Open Compute Project chair and board member and is on Fortune’s 40 Under 40 list of most influential people in technology.

speakers.title: Sr. Principal Engineer
speakers.bio:
Murugasamy (Sammy) Nachimuthu is a Sr. Principal Engineer and a lead cloud solutions architect at Intel Corporation. Sammy chairs OCP future technology initiative - Cloud Solution Model (CSM) WG. Sammy joined Intel in 1995, he played key roles in architecture development of Rack Scale Design (RSD), Intel® Optane™ DC Persistent Memory, UEFI, SAL, DIG64, ACPI, Redfish, NVMe Over Fabric standards; PCIe, CXL, Memory and CPU hot plug, RAS and impact less firmware updates; Intel processor and platform features. Sammy led BIOS/UEFI/Firmware implementation of various Intel® Xeon® and Intel® Itanium® server platforms. Sammy holds 70 patents.

Sammy graduated B.E in Electrical and Electronics Engineer and M.E in Computer Science from PSG College of Technology, Coimbatore, India

speakers.title: Hardware Systems Technologist
speakers.bio: Manoj Wadekar is a Hardware Systems Technologist driving storage technology and roadmaps at Facebook.   Manoj has been designing and building servers, storage, and network solutions for over 30 years. He has worked on a wide variety of architectures, including scale-up, scale-out, enterprise and hyper-scale. Manoj has evangelized Storage Disaggregation, NVMe over Fabric, Lossless Ethernet (DCB/CEE) in the standards bodies and industrial consortiums. Before joining Facebook, he held engineering positions at eBay, QLogic and Intel.

speakers.title: VP/Networking CTO
speakers.bio: Matt Bergeron is VP & Networking CTO at Keysight Technologies, were he drives early technology development and product strategy. Prior to this role, Matt held various hardware and RTL engineering positions at Ixia and DDN Storage. Matt has experience in compute, networking, and storage and enjoys working at the hardware-software boundary. He holds a MSEE from University of California, Los Angeles and a BSEE from Caltech. Matt has been awarded 16 U.S patents.

speakers.title: Sr. Director of Memory Solutions Lab
speakers.bio: Dr. Yang Seok Ki is Senior Director of Memory Solutions Lab at Samsung Semiconductor Inc. in San Jose, California. Since joining Samsung 2011, he has led in-storage computing projects including smart SSD and key-value SSD, and led the NVMe key-value standard, SNIA key-value API, and SNIA compute storage API at Samsung. He is also a member of the Open Computing Project (OCP) Future Technology Initiative. Prior to joining Samsung, he worked in Oracle's Server Technology Group. Prior to his industrial career, he was involved in high performance computing, grid, and cloud research at the Institute of Information Sciences at the University of Southern California and the Center for Networked Systems at the University of California, San Diego. He received his Ph.D., Master's and Bachelor's degrees in Electrical Engineering and Computer Engineering from Seoul National University, and completed the Engineering Leadership Professional Program (ELPP) at University of California, Berkeley.

title: Workload Diversity, Computational Geo-distribution and Sustainability Top Market Forces Driving Data Center Innovation
description: The accelerating digitization of the enterprise and evolving expectations of consumers is driving workload diversity and a realignment of how we distribute computation between centralized data centers and edge locations. This re-distribution of computation is giving rise to an integrated and fast-growing IT ecosystem where computational capability and capacity are placed near where they are needed. At the root of this shift are applications that need to seamlessly integrate into real-time business processes and leisure activities, which can require very low latency response times and rapid processing of very large AI and ML data sets. A rapidly growing IT ecosystem threatens to consume alarming amounts of resources and make a significant contribution to carbon emissions, driving the need for adoption of more sustainable methods for data centers. This keynote will detail these three trends and outline areas where innovation is needed in IT ecosystems for distributed computation, composable silicon for workload diversity and power management and cooling for sustainability.

title: Sustainablility-as-a-Service: A New IT Hardware Business Model for the 21st Century
description:
Transforming IT hardware to a service that cloud & infrastructure providers use. as-a-Service will be the only way to reach circularity in-line with economics, as the hardware will remain property of the manufacturer ("on their books") so they have a natural incentive to extend the lifetime of it, repair, and refurbish – it's their asset.

If we don't change to this model, hardware makers will always want hardware to break, so they can sell new hardware – that can only be solved if they don't actually sell hardware, but rather rent it out.

What that means is also a commoditization at the same time, likely it will not be hardware that is provided as-a-service, but rather computational power and storage (this model was around already in the past with SUN Microsystems), you don't rent a server you rent CPU cycles, GB of memory, and storage capacity.

title: Pushing the boundary conditions of data centers facilitates innovative circular economy approaches
description:
Authors: Leonie Banzer & Andreas Hantsch

Sustainability and Data Center Efficiency - Data are the new fuel. We call it ‘Energy to Data, Data to Heat’. Placing data centers at locations where both the demands for information technology and heat coincide with server virtualization and load-optimization allows circular economy approaches. We investigate the effect of direct hot-liquid cooling characteristics on the energy reusage factor. Depending upon the location, 85 % to slightly less than 100 % values are achievable. Optimized servers and components significantly contribute to the objective.
social_description: Learn how to stop wasting energy by including data centers into circular economy approaches.
attendees_expected_learnt: The attendees will learn what will be necessary to incorporate data centers seamlessly into circular economy approaches.

title: Hybrid and Resonant Switched-Capacitor Converters: Achieving Ultra-Efficient and Compact 48 V Datacenter Power Delivery
description: Power Delivery and Efficiency - This work presents a family of high-performance hybrid resonant switched-capacitor (SC) power converters for datacenter power delivery, from 48 V to an intermediate bus voltage (12, 8, 6 V). This technology can achieve significantly higher efficiency and power density than the state-of-the-art solutions and has the potential to greatly reduce the power distribution loss in future datacenters. The key operating waveforms and performance of the 48-to-12 V and 48-to-6 V resonant SC converters are highlighted in this presentation.
social_description: Ultra-Efficient and Compact hybrid SC converters for datacenters
attendees_expected_learnt: Attendees expect to learn the 1) 48 V two-stage architecture by using hybrid switched-capacitor converters, 2) extremely compact and efficient 48-to-12 V cascaded resonant converter, 3) high-performance 48-to-6 V cascaded series-parallel converter.

title: Medium Voltage Power Delivery Architecture for Data Centers
description: Power Delivery and Efficiency - This paper presents a novel medium voltage architecture for supplying power to data centers. Conventional architecture includes a 60Hz bulky facility transformer that converts MV to LV ac and then the LV ac undergoes 5 stages of power conversion before being finally fed to CPU load with an overall efficiency less than 80%. Also, large amount of LV cables is laid out throughout the data center, causing additional losses and cost. The proposed medium voltage (MV) power delivery architecture eliminates the 60Hz transformer and the LV cables and uses low amperage MV cables to deliver the power directly to the server rack which houses a 3-stage power conversion circuit to increase the overall efficiency by more than 10%. An isolated MV PFC rectifier is needed to realize this architecture and is the primary focus of this paper. Novel 14.4kV SiC Austin SuperMOS is developed for this application.
social_description: This paper presents a novel medium voltage architecture for supplying power to data centers.
attendees_expected_learnt: The proposed medium voltage (MV) power delivery architecture eliminates the 60Hz transformer and the LV cables of the conventional architecture and uses low amperage MV cables to deliver the power directly to the server rack which houses a 3-stage power conversion circuit to increase the overall efficiency by more than 10%. An isolated MV PFC rectifier is needed to realize this architecture and is the primary focus of this paper. A diode bridge front-end generates a rectified sinusoidal voltage at the MV dc link. The high frequency stage is a dc/dc DAB which uses novel 14.4kV SiC SuperMOS switch in the primary side full bridge and 600V SiC switch on the secondary LV full bridge. The isolation is provided by a 20:1 30kHz transformer. Control objectives of unity power factor grid operation and constant LV dc voltage of 380V are achieved by a constant frequency double phase shift modulation which also ensure zero voltage switched turn-on of all devices.

title: Vertical Stacked 48V-1V Voltage Regulator for Ultra High Current Microprocessors
description: Power Delivery and Efficiency - This paper presents a 48 V-1 V merged-two-stage hybrid-switched-capacitor converter with a Linear Extendable Group Operated Point-of-Load architecture for ultra-high-current microprocessors, featuring 3-D stacked packaging and coupled inductors for miniaturized size and vertical power delivery. The architecture is highly modular and scalable.  The series-connected switched-capacitor circuits split high input voltage into multiple stacked low voltage domains. The parallel-connected multiphase buck circuits distribute high output current into multiple low current paths.  A 780 A vertical stacked microprocessor voltage regulator with a peak efficiency of 91.1% and a full load efficiency of 79.2% at an output voltage of 1 V with liquid cooling is built and tested. This is the first demonstration of a 48 V-1 V microprocessor voltage regulator achieving over 1 A/mm2 current density and 1,000 W/in3 power density.
social_description: Vertical Stacked 48V-1V/780A VRM for extremely high current area density and power density
attendees_expected_learnt:
This presentation will introduce a vertical-stacked LEGO-PoL voltage regulator for ultra high current microprocessors.

In this presentation:

The trend of 48V voltage regulator modules (VRMs) for modern microprocessors and an overview of the state-of-the-art 48V VRMs are introduced.

We will discuss a modular and scalable 48V VRM solution (LEGO-PoL) with the merged-two-stage operation, vertical power delivery, high current area density, and high power density - 1) Topology, 2) Operational mechanism, 3) and Control.

We will discuss the LEGO-POL converter's design guidelines - 1) Component design and 2) PCB design.

Key enablers of the high current area density and power density will be discussed: 1) 3D packaging and 2) Vertical coupled inductor.

speakers.title: Postdoctoral Research Associate
speakers.bio: Jaeil Baek is a postdoctoral research associate in the Princeton power electronics laboratory at Princeton University, where he has been working on high-performance point-of-load converters collaborating with Google and Intel. He received the M.S. and Ph.D. degrees in electrical engineering from the Korea Advanced Institute of Science and Technology, Daejeon, South Korea, in 2015 and 2018, respectively, where he worked on digital control approach of converter and grid interface power electronics such as server power supply, adapter, and on-board charger. He was the recipient of the Research Outstanding Award from the Korea Advanced Institute of Science and Technology and Global Ph.D. Fellowship and Postdoctoral Fellowship from the National Research Foundation of Korea.

speakers.title: Graduate Student
speakers.bio:
Youssef Elasser received the B.S. degree in electrical engineering and computer science with a concentration in electric power from Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute, Troy, NY, USA, in 2018. He is currently working toward the Ph.D. degree with Princeton University, Princeton, NJ, USA.

His research interests include renewable energy storage systems, grid-interface power electronics, and novel magnetics design for switching power supplies.

Mr. Elasser received the Grainger Scholars Award for distinguished undergraduates studying electric power while he was at Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute. At Princeton, he received the First Place Award from the 2019 Princeton Innovation Forum, and the NSF Graduate Research Fellowship in 2020.

He is an Assistant Professor of Electrical and Computer Engineering and Andlinger Center for Energy and the Environment at Princeton University, where he leads the Princeton Power Electronics Research Lab. His research interests include complex power architecture, power magnetics, control, and machine learning methods for high performance power electronics.

slides.description: Power Delivery and Efficiency - This paper presents a 48 V-1 V merged-two-stage hybrid-switched-capacitor converter with a Linear Extendable Group Operated Point-of-Load architecture for ultra-high-current microprocessors, featuring 3-D stacked packaging and coupled inductors for miniaturized size and vertical power delivery. The architecture is highly modular and scalable.  The series-connected switched-capacitor circuits split high input voltage into multiple stacked low voltage domains. The parallel-connected multiphase buck circuits distribute high output current into multiple low current paths.  A 780 A vertical stacked microprocessor voltage regulator with a peak efficiency of 91.1% and a full load efficiency of 79.2% at an output voltage of 1 V with liquid cooling is built and tested. This is the first demonstration of a 48 V-1 V microprocessor voltage regulator achieving over 1 A/mm2 current density and 1,000 W/in3 power density.

speakers.title: VP Digital Design
speakers.bio:
Roger Rohatgi is the creative force behind digital design at bp. As vice president of digital design within bp’s digital science and engineering team, he leads a community of innovative thinkers, user experience (UX) professionals and creatives focused on supercharging human experience design (HXD) to help bp reimagine energy for people and our planet.

Roger is accountable for design thought leadership and standards, including the administration of a global design system for bp. He also oversees agile and iterative design delivery and looks after career development for bp designers as the head of discipline for digital design. Roger has over 24 years of experience successfully managing projects and teams to create compelling user interfaces (UI), dynamic marketing and advertising campaigns, and engaging UX on enterprise software products, websites, mobile apps, interactive TV shows and social media for top brands and agencies. He conceptualized, created, and pioneered “Youtoo Social TV”, the first national social TV cable network in the US, with a world-class team and in partnership with famed producer, Mark Burnett. His creativity has won numerous awards/accolades, including Best User Experiences of 2020 Finalist in Fast Company for creative direction and work done for Motorola Solutions APX Next, and his work has been covered in USA Today, LA Times, Hollywood Reporter, Advertising Age and Forbes.com.

Giving back is important to Roger, and he frequently donates his time and knowledge to help others – offering pro-bono design support for non-profits and mentoring future designers through the OnDeck Design Fellowship and the Hexagon UX Design chapter. He is a member of the InVision Design Leadership Forum and helps lead the bp neuro diversity affinity group.

Roger holds a Bachelor of Arts from Valenti School of Communications at the University of Houston in Texas. He is a member of the Digital User Experience advisory board for The Manchester Metropolitan University, as well as a member of the Digital Accelerator advisory board for Southern Methodist University (SMU).

title: Reliability of Cloud Scale Hardware Through Performance and Health Monitoring Using on-chip Telemetry
description: High Performance and Hardware Acceleration - Cloud scale data centers push the limits of performance for zero down-time applications. Compute, networking, and storage infrastructure is dominating semiconductor consumption, with AI and HPC ASICs increasingly based on leading edge FinFET silicon manufacturing processes and advanced 2.5D and 3D packaging technologies. With these advanced technologies for always-on applications, comes a plethora of new challenges for hardware health and fault diagnostics. In this paper we will present how deep data analytics based on Universal Chip Telemetry (UCT), can be used to assure production quality and lifetime reliability for a more robust, resilient, and easily maintainable data center.
social_description: Cloud scale hardware reliability and health monitoring using on-chip telemetry
attendees_expected_learnt: Attendees can expect to learn about deep data analytics based on Universal Chip Telemetry (UCT), which is an emerging category for health and performance monitoring of data center HW. It allows chip and system manufacturers to develop and ship high quality devices, without latent or undetected defects. At the same time, data center operators can monitor the systems in operational lifetime to enjoy uninterrupted uptime, lower maintenance costs and the visibility required to scale advanced semiconductor devices in mission critical applications.

Registration for the 2021 OCP Global Summit will open Monday, August 2. This year's event will be a hybrid format, so we will offer both in-person and virtual options. Please see below for rates and deadlines.

IN-PERSON Early Bird Registration: $499  (Aug 2-31) General Registration: $599  (Sept 1-30) Late & Onsite Registration: $799  (Oct 1 - Nov 10)

VIRTUAL Virtual - All Access:  $199 (Aug 2 - Nov 30) Virtual - Limited:  Free

We encourage you to register early so that we can plan accordingly with any new safety regulations. 

Cancellation Policy

In-person tickets: Cancel on or before Sept 30, full refund. Cancel after Sept 30, no refund. Refund requests must go through the FNvirtual registration system or emailed to registration@opencompute.org. No refunds for virtual tickets.

title: Accelerating DLRM on an OCP M.2 Accelerator
description: High Performance and Hardware Acceleration - Recommendation  models  are  widely  deployed  by  a large  number  of  hyperscalars,  taking  up  significant  portions  of the  total  compute  time  in  data  centers.  However,  accelerating these models remains challenging due to their unique architecture with  low  compute  density  sparse  operators.  In  this  work,  we introduce our hardware accelerator for sparse operations, SEAL, which  is  compatible  with  the  OCP  Yosemite  v2  server  platform and  provides  a  performance  improvement  of  up  to 6.2×over  a solution  using  only  CPUs.
attendees_expected_learnt:
We will discuss the challenges of accelerating DLRMs, due to their unique architecture which includes low compute density sparse operations. We highlight why traditional solutions such as GPUs and hardware accelerators optimized for compute do not meet the unique challenges of recommendation model architectures well.

We will then introduce our hardware accelerator for sparse operations, SEAL, an OCP M.2 accelerator module designed to be deployed in the Glacier Point V2 carrier. 

We discuss the challenges in hardware architecture design and at the system level, and show how SEAL accelerates DLRM inference over a solution using only CPUs. We'll share the results of our benchmarking work, evaluating the performance of our hardware and software solutions on Facebook’s DLRM architecture.

title: DSS: High I/O Bandwidth Disaggregated Object Storage System for AI Applications
description: High Performance and Hardware Acceleration - With exponential data generation rate, specifically in applications like Deep learning, AI the demand for storage with high-bandwidth and great scalability that supports unstructured data format is increasing. To fulfill this need Samsung proposes DSS storage solution, which implements object Key-Value API on top NVMeOF SSD. The support of storage remote access protocols facilitates the disaggregation. Therefore, storage can be easily scaled. Besides object storage support and scalability, our architecture can provision the bandwidth demands for each application on each client server. This paper introduces our DSS Storage systems that support high-bandwidth per capacity for object-format data with an effortlessly scale-up feature. DSS uses some methods to deterministically provide bandwidth to the client sessions to mitigate the contention and starvation. Therefore, our storage design is essential for large concurrent multi-session workloads with intensive reads such as AI training.
social_description: Disaggregated object storage with high I/O bandwidth and great scalability
attendees_expected_learnt:
- Get familiar with Samsung disaggregated object storage devices and fully utilize the devices.

- Understand our novel architectural and it's components to achieve the high-bandwidth  

- How to set up, experiments and evaluate our system 

- provide the information on how to adapt their already existing AI model into our system and improve the performance 

- Our future system improvement

title: Accelerating Data Analytics with Computational Storage Drives
description: High Performance and Hardware Acceleration - This paper presents a design solution that enables data analytics system off-load the costly scan operations into computational storage drives (CSDs). The key idea is to customize the column-store data structure so that CSDs could utilize low-cost embedded processor cores to achieve high-speed data scan. Experimental results show that, using the proposed design approach, a single ARM Cortex A-53 core could achieve over 1GB/s data scan throughput, which can further enable over 5x TPC-H query latency reduction.
attendees_expected_learnt: Through a specific example of data scan offload for analytics systems, attendees will learn how data structure enhancements can improve application performance in heterogeneous compute environments, particularly where a workload is handled in-part by low-cost embedded compute cores.

title: A path for 224Gb/s Solution for Intra Data Center Interconnect
description: Networking - This paper presents a comparative study between different modulations formats for Intra data center (DC) for both 224Gb/s electrical links and 200Gb/s per lambda for optical intensity modulation and direct detection. A power performance tradeoff is assessed for PAM4, PAM6, and PAM8 solutions. The best-in-class 400G ZR 7nm FINFET data converters are used as a testbed for this assessment.
social_description: This paper presents a power performance comparative study for different implementations of 224Gb/s.
attendees_expected_learnt: This paper presents a power performance comparative study for different implementations of 224Gb/s electrical SERDES and extends its 200Gb per lambda optical links to enable the next generation of switches at 102.4Tb/s.

speakers.title: Director of Analog ASIC
speakers.bio: Dr Naim Ben-Hamida is the director of Hardware Engineering and a Distinguished Engineer at Ciena Corporation.  Dr. Naim Ben-Hamida is responsible for the development of high-speed analog IP’s for optical communication. The latest product delivered by his team is WL5n with the lowest 400G ZR power. He is currently co-supervising more than 15 Ph.D. and MSA students covering seven research and development projects with six Canadian universities. Dr Ben-Hamida holds an adjunct professor position with Carleton University. He has published more than 100 international papers and holds more than forty patents. Prior to Ciena/Nortel, He co-founded Opmaxx Inc, a mixed-signal design and test company. He held a vice president position and led the company to an acquisition. Dr Ben-Hamida had a PHD and MSA from Ecole Polytechnique de Montreal

title: Automated Telemetry for Data Center Physical Fiber Layer Analysis
description: Networking - With the current scale of hyperscale data centers and the deployment of higher speed optics, characterizing the state of the fiber plant will be critical to achieve acceptable link performance levels. The robotic Telescent Network Topology Manager allows this characterization to be performed remotely using a range of integrated test equipment and can be integrated into other Software Defined Networking functions to bring visibility to the physical fiber layer.
social_description: Telescent NTM allows remote characterization of physical fiber plant in hyperscale data centers.
attendees_expected_learnt: While higher speed optics and link requirements highlight the need for characterization of the fiber plant, the number of connections makes manual testing unfeasible. Telescent has developed the Network Topology Manager (NTM), a 1000 x 1000 robotic cross-connect. This device can connect, disconnect, and reconnect fibers in an arbitrary manner. A key feature is this device enables test equipment to be automatically switched into a given fiber link to enable characterization of fiber performance. Power sources, power monitors and OTDRs are examples of equipment that may be incorporated into the NTM, permitting in-situ fiber characterization to take place without human intervention. Since the NTM can insert a range of test equipment, Layer 2 and 3 test equipment can also be inserted to monitor traffic. Additionally, the Telescent system can be used to reconfigure the fiber paths of live networks to optimize performance or respond to broken links.

title: Wide and parallel LED-based optical links using multi-core fiber for chip-to-chip communications
description: Networking - We demonstrate >200 optical lanes in 0.5mm diameter imaging fiber with a speed-optimized GaN LED array, and independently, NRZ links of each LED to 10Gb/s over meters, extrapolating to >2Tb/s at a density >10Tb/mm2.

title: Super-conductive Data-Center
description: Sustainability and Data Center Efficiency - This paper is highlighting the overlooked area of inefficiencies in the Power Distribution chain of large scale Data Centers and proposes a new approach on how to run Data Centers directly on super-conductive direct current (SCDC) power. On top of it, we present sustainable options for Building materials and Backup Generators. Creating the ultimate open specification for the Hyperscale Data Center of the Future in 2021. In the spirit of the OCP, the specification and the Data Center CAD Modell are open-sourced ready to deploy.
social_description: Super-conductive Data Center - Uncovering power distribution inefficiencies and build SFI stuff
attendees_expected_learnt:
How to build Data Centers from Timber

How to eliminate Power shelves from the OCP Rack

How to save operational costs  with super-conductive Busbars

How to run an High Available Data Center without paying for Diesel Backup Genset

How to manage a climate-positive building

speakers.title: Principal Analyst for Data Center Storage
speakers.bio:
At Omdia, Dennis covers data center storage technologies, including SAN, NAS, DAS, cloud storage, NVMe over Fabrics (NVMeOF), and software-defined storage (SDS). He has more than 25 years of broad storage industry technology experience, which includes storage systems design, product and project management, corporate and product strategy, and storage innovations development and market insight. Specializing in storage technologies, Dennis has created winning products, such as the MetaStore SAN, which grew to $60 million in annual revenue. He also holds patents in storage systems design, data caching, and hybrid cloud data migration. He is certified in Agile development practices and cloud solution architectures.

Before joining Omdia (formerly IHS Markit) in 2018, Dennis worked at NetApp and contributed to the E-Series product line, which is worth $1 billion. He also held positions at Symbios Logic, Engenio, and LSI. Dennis earned his Bachelor of Science in mechanical engineering at University of Wisconsin- Platteville, US and MBA from Wichita State University, US.

speakers.title: Sr. Principal Engineer

Murugasamy (Sammy) Nachimuthu is a Sr. Principal Engineer and a lead cloud solutions architect at Intel Corporation. Sammy chairs OCP future technology initiative - Cloud Solution Model (CSM) WG. Sammy joined Intel in 1995, he played key roles in architecture development of Rack Scale Design (RSD), Intel® Optane™ DC Persistent Memory, UEFI, SAL, DIG64, ACPI, Redfish, NVMe Over Fabric standards; PCIe, CXL, Memory and CPU hot plug, RAS and impact less firmware updates; Intel processor and platform features. title: Telemetry/Diagnostics Remote Service Model
description: Communication of data from an end-machine (server) to the management/monitoring framework could happen in two modes: strictly extracting measurements from the machine (telemetry) or bi-directional interaction, forming some kind of diagnostics. On a larger scale, collecting information and transferring it across responsibility areas poses several challenges. The CSM workgroup is designing an extended standard, based on such needs.

title: Inband-Management Agent (IMA)
description: Inband management is widely used for both telemetry and diagnostics/debugging purposes. Today most of this is either proprietary and/or specific to each hardware component. The CSM is standardizing Inband-Management-Agent. The API standardization covering both telemetry and diagnostics will make it easy to build tools and ensure interoperability of tools. The reference architecture will make it easy to build in-band management agents and allow sharing of inband management agents.

speakers.title: Staff Software Engineer
speakers.bio: George Kola has over 20 years experience designing software. Currently, he is a staff software engineer at Google where he currently leads Modular Google System (MoSys),  Google's in-band management platform.  Before MoSys, George designed Google Chat and took it from a prototype to a generally available product.  Prior to Google, George has served in a variety of technical leadership roles:  (1) served as CTO of Voxer, a real time voice-messaging app where he designed the client-server api and high performance networking layer, (2) co-founded Mindmeld a conversational AI platform and served as Chief architect and the took conversational AI from idea to a publicly available product,  (3) architected Truveo/AOL Video search. George has deep expertise in real-time messaging, conversational AI,  video search and large scale distributed systems.  George got his PhD in computer science  from University of Wisconsin Madison and holds 5 patents.

title: Device Management Control (DMC) - Effective Out-Of-Band Device Management System Architecture
description: Effective device status information is mostly collected through in-band management path including device health information even though BMC is widely deployed in devices. In-band critical data collection is disrupted when any device failure occurs. An effective out-of-band device management scheme is designed to resolve the issue. OpenBMC and incumbent hardware management systems can simply leverage this scheme with no infrastructure modification between remote management servers and host servers.

speakers.title: Principal Engineer, System Architect
speakers.bio: He leads composite technology research and development for SSD and Storage System such as system optimization technology and storage out-of-band management solution in Memory division, Samsung Electronics. Last year he developled SSD reference system called Poseidon V1 which is a server system based on PM9A3 E1.S Gen4 SSD and composite technology like Tool-less designed SSD, and he presented "Open Reference System and Tool-less Design" in '20 OCP Korea Regional Summit. And, this year, he is leading Poseidon V2 system developement which is a server system based on PM1743 E3.S Gen5 SSD and it'll be demo on '21 OCP global summit. Also, he has an expertise in datacenter storage form factor and he is actively participating in PCI-SIG, SNIA and OCP. Recently he introduced Effective-Out-Of-Band Management System Architecture in OCP FTI work group and he will announce it in OCP FTS CSM breakout session.

moderator.title: Sr. Principal Engineer
moderator.bio:
Murugasamy (Sammy) Nachimuthu is a Sr. Principal Engineer and a lead cloud solutions architect at Intel Corporation. Sammy chairs OCP future technology initiative - Cloud Solution Model (CSM) WG. Sammy joined Intel in 1995, he played key roles in architecture development of Rack Scale Design (RSD), Intel® Optane™ DC Persistent Memory, UEFI, SAL, DIG64, ACPI, Redfish, NVMe Over Fabric standards; PCIe, CXL, Memory and CPU hot plug, RAS and impact less firmware updates; Intel processor and platform features. Sammy led BIOS/UEFI/Firmware implementation of various Intel® Xeon® and Intel® Itanium® server platforms. Sammy holds 70 patents.

Sammy graduated B.E in Electrical and Electronics Engineer and M.E in Computer Science from PSG College of Technology, Coimbatore, India

speakers.title: Research Scientist
speakers.bio: Over his career in energy efficiency and sustainability policy research, Christopher Payne has focused on understanding how decisions related to energy consumption are made, how public policy shapes those decisions, and how energy policy can be made more efficient, effective, and persistent. Dr. Payne is a recognized expert in organizational decision-making related to energy and sustainability, with a research specialty in institutional acquisition processes and their role in clean energy technology adoption. He also specializes in adoption of innovation in energy-intensive industries, including data centers, laboratories, clean rooms, and hospitals.

title: ON DEMAND: Indoor/Outdoor 7.2x 5G O-RAN Standards Compliant Base Station Design Example
description: Networking - With O-RAN Alliance’s drive to move towards an open ecosystem and interoperable building blocks, AccelerComm and Silicom have created an O-RAN standards-compliant Layer 1 High PHY solution over an open fully-programmable platform based on an FPGA and implemented it as a PCIe add-in card. This paper aims to demonstrate a design example of this advanced integration and the benefits it can bring to Network Infrastructure Solutions providers.
social_description: AccelerComm and Silicom partner up to provide a Layer 1 High-PHY FPGA based accelerator function.
attendees_expected_learnt: The attendees will be able to learn how AccelerComm and Silicom partner up to provide a Layer 1 High PHY accelerator function by utilising AccelerComm's High PHY IPs, i.e. a full integration of CB (Code Block) LDPC decoder, TB (Transport Block) LDPC decoder wrapper, Polar decoder and QAM demodulator into PUSCH channel (the “PUSCH Decoder”), and CB LDPC encoder, TB LDPC encoder wrapper and QAM modulator into PDSCH channel (the “PDSCH Encoder”), integrated onto an Intel S10DX Stratix 10 FPGA on the Silicom Lightning Creek card, with less resource consumption (only 20% for 2*4T2R and 30% for 2*4T4R) and less power consumption (up to 38% power saving for LDPC processing and up to 73% saving for Polar processing).

speakers.title: Solutions Architect
speakers.bio: Dr Taihai Chen is the Solutions Architect at AccelerComm, which provides high-performance Layer 1 High-PHY IP to communications equipment manufacturers in the telecoms sector around the globe. His job allows him to bridge the gap between AccelerComm and our customers and deliver best-in-class solutions to achieve their goals. Before co-founding AccelerComm, he was a research fellow at the University of Southampton focusing on high throughput wireless receiver design. He received his PhD in Electronics and Electrical Engineering from the University of Southampton in 2015. He has published several papers in IEEE with over 450 citations and is coauthor of 5 UK patents.

speakers.title: Principal Analyst for Data Center Storage
speakers.bio:
At Omdia, Dennis covers data center storage technologies, including SAN, NAS, DAS, cloud storage, NVMe over Fabrics (NVMeOF), and software-defined storage (SDS). He has more than 25 years of broad storage industry technology experience, which includes storage systems design, product and project management, corporate and product strategy, and storage innovations development and market insight. Specializing in storage technologies, Dennis has created winning products, such as the MetaStore SAN, which grew to $60 million in annual revenue. He also holds patents in storage systems design, data caching, and hybrid cloud data migration. He is certified in Agile development practices and cloud solution architectures.

Before joining Omdia (formerly IHS Markit) in 2018, Dennis worked at NetApp and contributed to the E-Series product line, which is worth $1 billion. He also held positions at Symbios Logic, Engenio, and LSI. Dennis earned his Bachelor of Science in mechanical engineering at University of Wisconsin- Platteville, US and MBA from Wichita State University, US.

title: Registration
description:
Registration for the 2021 OCP Global Summit will open Monday, August 2. This year's event will be a hybrid format, so we will offer both in-person and virtual options. Please see below for rates and deadlines.

IN-PERSON Early Bird Registration: $499  (Aug 2-31) General Registration: $599  (Sept 1-30) Late & Onsite Registration: $799  (Oct 1 - Nov 10)

VIRTUAL Virtual - All Access:  $199 (Aug 2 - Nov 30) Virtual - Limited:  Free

We encourage you to register early so that we can plan accordingly with any new safety regulations. 

Cancellation Policy

In-person tickets: Cancel on or before Sept 30, full refund. Cancel after Sept 30, no refund. Refund requests must go through the FNvirtual registration system or emailed to registration@opencompute.org. No refunds for virtual tickets.

title: Networking and New Data Center Challenges - presented by Meta
description: In this keynote, Meta will share our perspective on how openness and disaggregation at every level, starting with silicon and moving up to the overall system, building, and network architecture, can give us new flexibility and capabilities to best support demanding applications such as AI. We will speak from a network perspective, given the network ensures all tiers are functioning together in the highest performing, efficient, sustainable, and open infrastructure we can build. We will review our previous OCP networking work, highlight our newest contributions with OCP partners, and look forward to the new challenges to address.
social_description: Omar Baldonado (Meta) covers innovative Network development to support new, demanding apps.
attendees_expected_learnt:
- new OCP Network switch contributions

- new OCP Network SAI development

- new OCP Network optics work

- tie-in to OCP Time Appliance/innovation

- themes of AI, efficiency/sustainability, software, and future

title: A New Era with Efficient Cloud-Native Processors: Open Collaboration for Rapid Innovation - presented by Ampere Computing
description:
CSPs are making tremendous progress executing on their long-term vision of a sustainable data centers. They are focusing on optimizations to improve infrastructure efficiency. There is room for optimizations at the component level, especially around server processors. Participants have benefited from OCP's forum and published specifications, design files, and software contributions. Ampere is committed to this cause with the following contributions: 

  • Industry first dual socket Arm server specification and design files
  • ODM platform in the OCP Marketplace
  • OpenBMC and EDK2 Open Source firmware

Renee will highlight industry trends including cloud native processor adoption and discuss the strength of open collaboration for rapid innovation. Renee will address the need to nurture power efficient Arm based CPU and ecosystem with open standards to meet the challenging goals of sustainable future.
social_description: Cloud-Native Processors and the strength of open collaboration for rapid innovation.
attendees_expected_learnt:
Over the past decade, virtually all servers have been based on the x86 architecture, but new Arm-based options like Ampere® Altra® have emerged with leadership in performance and power efficiency. It is important that this technology be easily accessible across the industry to anyone building, developing on, or running in a cloud. OCP is the ideal community within which to openly collaborate, share designs and architectural innovations around the component ecosystem. 

Renee James will highlight industry trends including cloud native processor adoption and discuss the strength of open collaboration for rapid innovation. Renee will address the need to nurture power efficient Arm based CPU and ecosystem with open standards to meet the challenging goals of a sustainable future.

speakers.title: CEO
speakers.bio:
Ms. James founded Ampere Computing in 2017, where she is currently the Chairman and CEO. Ampere produces high performance microprocessors for cloud and edge computing. She  had a lengthy career at Intel where she served as President of Intel until her departure in 2016. During her tenure with Intel, she was the first female General Manager of a business unit as well as the first woman Executive Vice President that led R&D and global manufacturing operations.  James was also chief of staff to Intel founder, Andy Grove midway through her career for over 4 years.

James has vast, global operating experience in both hardware and software development and manufacturing of semiconductors.  She has led several development sites around the globe as well as directed the government affairs in those regions. She is an active voice for diversity and representation in technology as well as the future of the U.S. Semiconductor industry.

title: Easy Edge: It’s Open and It’s Everything - presented by ITRenew
description: Demand for new Edge capabilities is relentless, yet efforts to make it easy to deploy and scale infrastructure have been stuck in low gear…until now. A group of industry leaders have created “Easy Edge” solutions based entirely on OCP hardware. Circular, open architecture solutions that build best-in-class hyperscale tech into the most cost-efficient and sustainable gear. Now OCP can enable smart everything: from campuses to cities, lamp posts to roadways, at scale. And help customers and partners reach ESG targets faster. OCP members ITRenew, the leader in data center circularity, and Schneider Electric, the leader in the digital transformation of energy management and automation, have partnered with EDJX and VPS to enable broad, rapid deployment and monetization of non-traditional data center environments. Learn how all-in-one, integrated solutions - inclusive of power, cooling, heating, switching, compute, storage, networking and instant CDN – make “Easy Edge” reality for all.
social_description: The wait’s over. With Easy Edge you can deploy and scale OCP infrastructure for smart everything.
attendees_expected_learnt:
• How the Easy Edge is making it possible for OCP to enable smart everything

• How turnkey all-in-one solutions make it easy to deploy and scale Edge architecture

• How to accelerate sustainability to achieve ESG goals faster 

• What makes cell towers, roadways, campuses and other Edge and IoT deployments such a compelling source of profitable, sustainable growth.

• What it takes to implement this kind of change on this scale

speakers.title: President
speakers.bio: Ali is President of ITRenew, where she oversees all revenue channels and leads creation of new circular data center models and sustainable technology solutions that are changing how the industry designs, sources, uses and reuses IT hardware. Her work with hyperscalers, service providers & enterprises worldwide is bringing the financial, carbon and materials advantages of open hardware and circularity to the broader market. A graduate of Yale and the London School of Economics with 20+ years of cloud and enterprise biz dev expertise, Ali served as a UN Technology Innovations Labs advisor, founded Rethink: Circular, and has been named to the iMasons IM100 and as one of Silicon Valley Business Journal’s 100 Women of Influence.

title: Adoption Of Open Hardware at East Africa's Largest Telco Company
description:
Safaricom is the largest Communications Service Provider (CSP) and the largest business in East Africa. With a subscriber base of over 35Million, and recently acquired a license to operate in Ethiopia ( a country with a population of over 100M), the business has set sight to transformation towards becoming a digital service provider (DSP). 

To achieve this vision of becoming a DSP, we have to unlock the power of data and analytics. We also want to fast track innovation by acquiring scalable, cost effective, efficient and environmentally friendly compute solutions.  That is why Open is part of our philosophy. We shall continue adopting both open hardware and software as we pursue our sustainability goals. For the current acquisition of OCP Accepted Solutions, the majority of the workload running on this systems will be big data and analytics. In the future, we intend to port all our operation support and business systems to OCP accepted platforms.
social_description: Open hardware adoption is indispensable in our digital transformation journey.
attendees_expected_learnt:
- Open hardware adoption in Telecom (Specifically Safaricom).

- What we evaluate before acquiring an open based platform.

- Preparing teams for adoption of open systems (hardware and software).

- Building for sustainability at the telco data center.

- How to progressively shake-off legacy systems.

title: Open Innovation: The Next Step in Memory Evolution - presented by Samsung
description:
The key for data center innovation is through open community and collaboration.  Samsung introduced ‘Project Poseidon’ in 2020, a project based on multi-vendor collaboration. This program not only resulted in a new innovative hardware platform and the world’s first OCP recognized SSD but also in mainline open-source software contributions, both to existing and new projects. The Poseidon offering is just the first step as Samsung is constantly looking for opportunities to enable broader collaborations and community contributions.

In this keynote, Samsung will present why we are investing in "Open Innovation", what has been achieved, and how those affect the ecosystem. The presentation will also touch upon recent Samsung innovations in both hardware and software offerings such as EDSFF SSDs, CXL Memory Expander, ZNS SSD, and next version of PoseidonOS. Finally, Samsung will also unveil the next-generation open hardware system that will support variety of new devices.
attendees_expected_learnt: The attendees will learn how Samsung has changed and what are the results since we announced an open community based multi-industry collaboration program, Project Poseidon, in 2020. They will also learn how small beginnings have evolved and how they affect a large company. Samsung will share our open-source contributions, and industry adoption and deployment story of Poseidon system. Moreover, the attendees can learn about Samsung's vision and strategies to expand memory eco-system with industries in OCP.

title: The Path to 5B Cores - Presented by Intel
description: Intel’s contributions are in alignment with OCP’s strategic areas to drive the future of secure, reliable, sustainable computation from cloud to edge. Intel’s vision of Modularity is to support a baseboard layout and architecture allowing OxMs to swap out modules for manageability and IO. Intel has implemented manageability subsystems which conform to SCM 1.0 and is chairing the SCM 2.0 workstream to allow a management module for dual partition systems. Intel’s vision of At Scale Operations is to align OCP platforms with manageability standards. Intel has contributed profiles for common hardware manageability and server and rack manageability and conformance is a requirement for future OCP platform contributions and will lead to more secure implementation. Intel’s vision for Sustainability is to move towards a circular economy while reducing carbon impact. Intel is co-leading an OCP strategic workstream on component lifecycle that identifies best practices for circularity.
social_description: Contributions to OCP’s strategy to meet the need for data, reliably, securely, and sustainably.
attendees_expected_learnt: Attendees will see Intel's effort to support OCP's strategic direction. The strategies for Modularity, At Scale Operations, and Sustainability will be described in detail, as well as Intel’s recent Community contributions and an update on industry adoption.

speakers.title: Corporate Vice President, General Manager, Data Platforms Engineering & Architecture
speakers.bio:
Zane A. Ball is a corporate vice president and general manager of the Data Platforms Engineering & Architecture (DPEA) group. DPEA owns end-to-end engineering for Intel’s data center business and is responsible for designing and validating the latest data center platforms and enabling Intel’s customers to ramp and deploy platforms at scale.

Prior to his data center role, Ball was Co-GM of Intel’s foundry effort as a VP in the Technology and Manufacturing group. Ball has also served as a VP of the Client Computing Group including roles as GM of the desktop client business and as GM of global customer engineering.

Ball has a bachelor’s degree, master’s degree and Ph.D. in electrical engineering, all earned from Rice University.  He holds six patents in high-speed electrical design.

title: Expo Hall Talk - The Next Frontiers in Infrastructure Automation - Presented by Meta
description: Automation is key to scaling operations as it enables simplicity and enhances repeatability. Meta is investing in both logical and physical automation to enable our scaling. We have build and are continuing to expand a global fleet of data centers and point-of-presence (PoP) locations with significant server, storage, and network devices. In this talk, Meta will share some of the examples from how we support our PoP sites via physical automation to enhance simplicity and improve repeatability and what OCP community can contribute to develop standardized approaches to such applications.

title: Expo Hall Talk - How to go Carbon Negative in your DataCenter - Presented by Green Mountain
description: How has Sustainability evolved over the last decade, and how to implement a truly circular approach for a datacenter to enable a carbon negative solution. Green Mountain have recently announced two ground breaking projects for heat-reuse at two of their datacenters in Norway, where they are connecting the datacenters to a lobster farm and to a onshore trout fishfarm in an ecosystem that involves the ability to create both an amazing cost opportunity and a carbon negative/climate positive delivery.

title: Expo Hall Talk - Intel® Intelligent Fabric utilizing OCP Standards and P4 Programmability - Presented by Intel Corporation
description: Hear Intel’s vision for Intel® Intelligent Fabric as a part of   the Data Center of the Future and how it meets the connectivity needs of   cloud-native hyperscaler build out. Intel is collaborating across the   different network elements – processors, switches, Infrastructure Processing   Units (IPUs), Ethernet adapters, FPGAs, and optical connectivity - from both a hardware and software perspective to provide innovations to the data center   network architecture. Intel® Intelligent Fabric delivers intelligence, performance, along with network visibility and control to meet the needs of the future hyperscaler environment. As a foundation, Intel® Intelligent Fabric builds out with OCP SONiC, PINS, P4, SD-Fabric, DPDK, SPDK and Open Host-INT. Learn how these technologies collaborate together and how you can join in on the related community projects and standards development.

Every venue that receives the accreditation is vetted by GBAC as meeting all requirements for a safe, preventative, and responsive meetings facility.

title: Expo Hall Talk - Building The ZNS Ecosystem: A Community Effort - Presented by Samsung
description: The ZNS (Zoned Namespace) interface imposes significant modifications to the traditional block interface used to access SSDs.   Although these interface additions support leaner controller designs, it comes at a cost of not being a drop-in replacement for block-based storage software. The ecosystem changes needed to support ZNS are well beyond the scope of a single storage vendor. In this presentation, Samsung will share some of our key learnings concerning ZNS ecosystem development, particularly the enabling of ZNS in RocksDB.   Furthermore, we will discuss a storage abstraction we have developed that can serve as a foundation for ZNS-compatible software. Finally, we will invite attendees to collaborate in further development around ZNS software so the entire industry can enjoy the many benefits of ZNS.

title: Executive Talk - Open from Cloud to Edge, Building Our Solutions with Modular Design - Presented by Wiwynn
description: At Wiwynn we build flexible and easily managed platforms for   both the cloud and the edge infrastructure by applying Open technology and   our modular design architecture expertise. The building blocks that form the bedrock of our infrastructure offerings are based on major trends that we see in the industry. They are: As power density continues to rise, and we see a need for creative cooling solutions. As Processor choice increases, we see a need for a common management framework. As processor core count increases, we see a potential for higher utilization of resources. As 5G becomes pervasive, we see possibility for Edge servers designed for smaller DCs. Based on the above trends, Wiwynn will be sharing technology workshops   around Advanced Cooling Solutions (Immersion Cooling and Liquid Cooling) and Open (hardware, firmware) design.

title: OCP Impact Study 2021: Open Computing and Data Center Sustainability
description: For the fourth edition of their OCP Impact Study, Omdia went bigger than ever, surveying nearly 300 end users and top open compute vendors, to determine the adoption of technologies developed by the OCP community. Apart from showing an updated number for the revenue impact of the OCP, Omdia will discuss why data center operators across different regions are deploying open compute equipment, as well as what are their investment strategies for the coming years. For the first time, at the 2021 OCP Summit, Omdia will also show how the OCP is enabling data centers sustainability and what areas the community need to help operators with next. The discussion will also feature a review of the fastest growing workloads at respondents’ data centers. Please join us for this interactive session where you will see the latest OCP adoption trends and have opportunity to compare notes and discuss technology and market trends with the Omdia experts.

speakers.title: Principal Analyst for Data Center Storage
speakers.bio:
At Omdia, Dennis covers data center storage technologies, including SAN, NAS, DAS, cloud storage, NVMe over Fabrics (NVMeOF), and software-defined storage (SDS). He has more than 25 years of broad storage industry technology experience, which includes storage systems design, product and project management, corporate and product strategy, and storage innovations development and market insight. Specializing in storage technologies, Dennis has created winning products, such as the MetaStore SAN, which grew to $60 million in annual revenue. He also holds patents in storage systems design, data caching, and hybrid cloud data migration. He is certified in Agile development practices and cloud solution architectures.

Before joining Omdia (formerly IHS Markit) in 2018, Dennis worked at NetApp and contributed to the E-Series product line, which is worth $1 billion. He also held positions at Symbios Logic, Engenio, and LSI. Dennis earned his Bachelor of Science in mechanical engineering at University of Wisconsin- Platteville, US and MBA from Wichita State University, US.

badge_features.name: Speaker
badge_features.description: Adds Speaker "icon" to the General Attendee badge type

speakers.title: Head of Cloud and Data Center Research
speakers.bio:
At Omdia, Vlad is responsible for the cloud and data center research practice’s expanding roadmap, focused on disruptive trends such as the shift to edge computing, the evolution of compute silicon, and the need for efficiency improvements and sustainability in the data center industry.

Vlad joined Omdia, formerly IHS Markit Technology, in 2016. He developed many of our unique, industry-leading analyses including our flagship open computing equipment research and our three- way server market reconciliation process. He’s held senior positions at Intel and Ciena, where his data-led insights served as a central input into the companies’ strategies. Key market models he developed include an in-depth analysis of telecommunications network operations costs, a PC inventory tracker, and an actionable IOT market forecast. Vlad’s work has even facilitated decision- making in the British Parliament. He holds a Bachelor of Science degree in economics and management from Aston University, UK.

badge_features.name: Speaker
badge_features.description: Adds Speaker "icon" to the General Attendee badge type

speakers.title: Principal Analyst for Data Center Power, Cooling and Sustainability
speakers.bio:
At Omdia, Moises Levy, PhD, leads physical infrastructure research in UPS, thermal management, and sustainability. A seasoned engineer and data center subject matter expert, Moises capitalizes on his knowledge to analyze relevant market data and produce reports that add value for Omdia’s clients. 

Moises has over 25 years of professional experience, with a diverse background in planning, design, management, risk assessment, commissioning, audits, and strategic consulting for engineering projects. He has founded and managed engineering firms, with more than 15 years dedicated to data center infrastructure projects. He has led engineering projects across the IT, financial, healthcare, food and beverage, oil and gas, shopping mall, and hospitality industries.

He holds a PhD and master’s degree in electrical engineering, and bachelor’s degrees in electrical and civil engineering. He is a researcher, a contributor to standards and best practices, an author of numerous publications, and a speaker at major data center conferences..

title: Expo Hall Talk - Microsoft's approach to a sustainable cloud - Presented by Microsoft
description: In 2020, Microsoft made a series of sustainability commitments across four areas: Carbon, Water, Waste, and Ecosystems. Microsoft demonstrated the corporate leadership needed to drive cross company alignment to bet and invest big to build leading platforms for technology solutions that address environmental   challenges. In this session we will share some of the commitments and initiatives specific to Microsoft cloud, including Azure hardware and datacenters, as well as platform and service solutions enabling Microsoft, our partners, and customers to better understand their sustainability impact   and guide their journey to impact reductions.

title: OCP Solution Providers: The rise of Open OEMs
description:
In 2017, Atlancis started actively working on various whitebox and Open Hardware initiatives. Being a solution integrator for various OEMs before that, we had learnt the customer pain points of the closed technologies we offered. When we came across the Open Compute Foundation, we made a concise decision to be Africa's pioneering Open Solutions provider. We will no longer integrate pre-built solutions but rather provide open solutions from Data center to the Edge covering DC build, network, compute, rack & power. We started by building our Servernah Cloud, based on OCP circular economy gear. Atlancis has been an active advocate and thought leader for Open conversations in Africa. OCP gives companies like Atlancis and others and opportunity to contribute to the future of technology. 

I am passionate about bringing custom Open & Hyperscale technologies to Enterprises in Africa and I will be happy to present on ‘OCP Solution Provider: The rise of Open OEM’
social_description: Atlancis Technologies: From Solution Provider to Open OEM
attendees_expected_learnt:
Solution providers (SP) are central to the successful adoption of Open compute especially in telco and non-hyperscale enterprises.
Attendees will learn how we have created a business model that gives the customer peace of mind and flexibility that comes with Open compute solutions while saving 50%+ in Opex and Capex. We have established a support structure and escalation matrix that is jointly supported by ourselves and our software OEM partners. We believe by speaking more about the role of SPs, more organizations will be confident to embrace Open Compute since the advantages are clear.

title: Executive Talk - The Myths of Renewable Infrastructure: Banishing Misconceptions to accelerate OCP adoption - Presented by ITRenew
description: OCP is no stranger to myths and misconceptions. It comes with   the territory when the new and unknown threatens the status quo. Together we’ve worked to debunk fictions like Open can’t be as good, it’s impossible for anyone but hyperscalers to adopt, and it’s hard to deploy. In this Talk, we’ll tackle a fresh round of myths – those surrounding recertified OCP hardware. Despite all the   advantages circular economics brings to the data center – lower cost, better performance & resiliency, higher efficiency, time-to-value, and sustainability – many who could benefit still hesitate. Hear from an   experienced vanity HW and proprietary SW product manager who learned the truth rejected long-held false beliefs and offers a fresh take on OCP   acceleration through renewable IT infrastructure. She’ll cover the tough questions, give you the facts, and share breakthrough concepts – like reimagined supply chains that smash current roadblocks to bits – that will put any lingering objections to rest.

She’ll cover the tough questions, give you the facts, and share breakthrough concepts – like reimagined supply chains that smash current roadblocks to bits – that will put any lingering objections to rest.

title: Expo Hall Talk - Hardware adaptable, software programmable SmartNICs - Presented by Xilinx
description: In order to support the rapid evolution of enterprise and Cloud data centers, along with workload optimized computing services, the role of high-speed and smart networking has become an integral part of next generation data centers. This is driving an increased adoption of SmartNICs in data centers providing CPU offloads, virtualization, container acceleration and software defined flexible hardware acceleration. While maintaining networking performance and security with easy programmability, SmartNICs also provide flexibility to add future workload composability and accelerate feature velocity.  This talk provides an overview of how Xilinx combines heterogenous acceleration engines to provide the most efficient way to address the dynamic needs of data center networking.

title: Empowering Network Operations Teams with Pervasive Kubernetes Observability
description:
An increasing share of applications are built using containers that are orchestrated with Kubernetes. These cloud-native application environments tend to be highly distributed, with the majority of traffic comprised of East-West traffic flows within Kubernetes clusters. Network administrators typically have no visibility into these flows, increasing the difficulty of ensuring network and application performance. 

This talk reviews innovative approaches to simplifying Kubernetes networking and enhancing visibility from application flows through the overlay to the physical underlay network. We review how switch-based, line-rate flow monitoring can provide full visibility into application flows within and between Kubernetes clusters, including session duration, data transfer and end to end latency. We then discuss mechanisms to extend this deep application visibility into servers and into public cloud environments for full visibility across a hybrid multi-cloud environment.
social_description: The new edge requires a hybrid overlay fabric and SmartNICs to meet emerging requirements

title: Executive Talk - Open compute: hardware innovation for a sustainable future - Presented by Microsoft
description: The ongoing pandemic has sent a shock to the global economy, reverberating throughout the technology industry. With society’s refreshed demands for new ways of work, learn, and play, we’ve also seen demands for   cloud computing skyrocket, coupled with global supply chain disruptions and the growing challenge of meeting carbon reduction and circularity goals. With   modularity, efficiency, and sustainability at the forefront, new  contributions to the OCP community from silicon to systems are paving the way for a new era in open hardware design. Zaid Kahn, General Manager in Microsoft’s Azure Hardware Systems and Infrastructure group will detail Microsoft’s latest engagements in the open hardware ecosystem as we prepare to empower a global recovery with sustainable, reliable, and trusted cloud computing capabilities.

title: Expo Hall Talk - Open from Cloud to Edge 2.0 - Presented by Wiwynn Corporation
description: Wiwynn, as one of the active members of the OCP, thrives to continue to provide the best TCO, workload optimized IT solutions for data centers. In the 2021 OCP Summit, we are here to present our “Open from Cloud to Edge 2.0”. For cloud offering, we are excited to share with you our next generation   OCP 21”/19” abundant OCP inspired solutions, which are not only denser and more power efficient with next generation platforms, but most importantly, they are field proven in mega scale data centers. For edge offering, we have the Open Edge solutions for bare metal or virtual CU/DU, as well as platforms good for AI edge applications. Meanwhile, we are proud to present our   innovations for system and rack level software/firmware solutions. While servers are getting more powerful, cooling is crucial, and we cannot ignore this. We are showing the industry’s leading immersion cooling tank, with augmented reality hologram experiences. We are also showing the compact sized immersion cooling solution for AI and edge applications.

speakers.title: Executive Director
speakers.bio:
Steven is the Executive Director from Wiwynn, based in San Jose, CA. Steven is experienced as a solution architect for cloud infrastructure. Besides capturing the market vibe and identify growth opportunities, Steven’s other strengths lie in his ability to build relationships with suppliers, partners, and customers through transformative technologies. Furthermore, Steven is experienced with OCP and has the track record for deploying OCP as the game servers for the world’s most popular games.

Before joining Wiwynn, Steven held a senior technical operations manager position with Blizzard Entertainment and Riot Games. Steven was involved with the infrastructure expansion of World of Warcraft, Starcraft 2, Diablo 3, Battle.Net, and League of Legends.

Steven holds a Master's Degree in Engineering from Stanford. Steven is also an entrepreneur, who ran a startup company for 7 years went through funding, execution, and merger & acquisition.

title: Expo Hall Talk - Revolutionary Breakthrough for Extreme Scale High-Performance Storage - Presented by QCT
description: Distributed Asynchronous Object Storage (DAOS) is an open-source, high-performance storage system that leverages only persistent memory and NVMes to achieve cutting-edge speed. Aiming to utilize the high-speed storage devices and interfaces fully, DAOS delivers more IOPS, bandwidth, and better scalability than its counterpart all-flash file system. DAOS performance improves when running on QCT servers with third-gen Intel Xeon processors and Intel Optane PMem 200 technology. Lower PMem latency and higher PMem and PCI-e bandwidth enable DAOS to deliver a combination of peak IOPS for metadata and small files and unparalleled throughput for large files. We demonstrate the benefits of the DAOS storage system on real-life applications that require time-sensitive responses, such as weather forecast applications. DAOS supports the traditional POSIX interface, simplifying transitions from legacy code and operation scripts. In addition, with native support of the HDF5 interface, a popular I/O library in weather models, via the HDF5 plugin, DAOS performs at its full potential.

title: Bringing OpenBMC to HPE Servers at Criteo: A Collaborative Model
description: HPE and Criteo have been collaborating for the past year to deploy OpenBMC on Criteo's production servers. In this talk, we will walk you through this journey: why we are doing it, the challenges we are facing both technical and organizational and how we collaborate. We'll detail our progress and the readiness of OpenBMC from the perspective of a large OEM and a mid-sized CSP.
social_description: How HPE and Criteo are collaborating to bring OpenBMC on Criteo's production servers.
attendees_expected_learnt: Attendees will learn how a big OEM and a mid-sized CSP are collaborating to bring OpenBMC on production servers. This can help others learn from our experience to bootstrap their own OpenBMC effort.

speakers.title: Hardware engineer
speakers.bio: Vincent Minet leads the hardware engineering at Criteo where he and his team ensures the well-being of the server platform. His current focus is on switching it to open-source firmware.

speakers.title: Senior Strategist, Open Platform
speakers.bio: I am thrilled by computers. I spent a lot of time designing them at architectural and hardware level, and participated to crazy projects, including building up the biggest european super computer in the late 90's. I love to share my knowledge and enable people to design better computers. I am particularly focused on open technologies currently, which includes design tools like FreeCAD, KiCAD, and open source firmware projects like linuxboot and OpenBMC. I used to work for big companies, created a french based startup that I successfully sold to an american company in 2018. I am now part of HPE mainly focused on open platforms. What does it mean will be known in a couple of months / quarters and years.

speakers.title: Distinguished Technologist
speakers.bio: I’ve been a software and firmware developer for 30 years, going back to Compaq Deskpro and Systempro BIOS work in the early 90s. I’ve had a chance to work on many interesting projects from embedded firmware in C and assembly to enterprise management software in Java. I was one of the originators of the Redfish management standard. After a number of years working on HPE iLO BMC firmware, I’m currently leading HPE’s project to enable OpenBMC to run on our ProLiant servers.

title: Nautilus Joins OCP with a Focus on Sustainable High-Performance Compute
description: Nautilus Data Technologies patented Total Resource Usage Effectiveness (TRUE™) cooling closed water loop technology, a zero waste water-cooling system to sustainably unleash high performance compute. Nautilus validated the technology with its first commissioned floating data center in Stockton and plans to develop the first land-based facility in Maine 2022. The water-cooling technology improves the critical infrastructure efficiency by 75% when compared to the industry average while unlocking the compute density to 55kW and higher. This high-density computing power opens the door to wide-scale availability of demanding computing applications using artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning. These applications support innovations such as remote education, telemedicine, telework, smart city, smart grid, smart transportation, and manufacturing efficiency that delivers increasing value to society and enables greater productivity and sustainability.
attendees_expected_learnt:
Why Nautilus Data Technologies is:

  • 70% more energy efficient. Ulta Efficient- 1.15 PUE Advanced water-cooling system with industry leading PUE; 24/7, regardless of season or weather 
  • Cuts power consumption by 30%
  • Less land space required due to high density capacity
  • Quieter than traditional data centers
  • Land based or water based solutions
  • High Density: 100+KW per rack enables AI and machine learning; Using rear door cooling units, direct to chip, or immersion-high density is supported, allowing customers to get more data center per square foot
  • Sustainability-No consumption of drinking water and no wastewater production. Zero Chemicals: No use of water treatment chemicals, potent greenhouse gas, or ozone-depleting refrigerants. Safe for the Environment: No impact on water quality, fish, or wildlife. Reduce Pollution: 30+% net reduction in energy-related CO2 and air pollution.

speakers.title: Founder & Cheif Scientist
speakers.bio:
Arnold Magcale is founder and Chief Scientist of Nautilus Data Technologies. 

His previous roles include serving on the management team of Exodus Communications, he launched one of Silicon Valley’s first data centers. Mr. Magcale’s background includes executive positions at Motorola Mobility, where his team deployed the first global Droid devices, and LinkSource Technologies and The Quantum Capital Fund, serving as Chief Technology Officer. He was an early adopter and implementer of Cloud Computing and a member of the team at Danger, Inc., acquired by Microsoft and Loudcloud.


Mr. Magcale had a distinguished ten year career in the United States Navy Special Forces. His military and maritime expertise provided the foundation for inventing the world’s first commercial waterborne data center.

title: Executive Talk - Intel Cloud Innovations – A Review - Presented by Intel Corporation
description: This talk covers the Intel Cloud innovations in areas of Open Firmware, CXL Memory and Liquid Cooling. Intel contributions and plans to enable OCP Open System Firmware via FSP will be discussed. Further, Intel contributions to OpenBMC and the areas of innovations it unlocks such as RAS error collection, error log standardization will be discussed. Intel CXL Memory Buffer POC and how it enables support for disaggregated memory will also be discussed. Immersion cooling is a key area of innovation in Datacenters especially with emergence of edge. This talk will discuss immersion cooling   options, liquid, immersion cooling solutions with focus on single phase immersion cooling.
