slides.name: Expo Hall Talk - Power Up, Stay On, Run Secure with Open-source Platform Firmware - Presented by AMI
slides.description:
A platform is a collection of hardware and firmware components needed to boot, operate and secure a system. However, most platform firmware is a black box that system owners do not control and cannot change. Open-source firmware offers a unique opportunity for system owners to own the   foundational firmware of their platform. This moves the point of control back to the system owners and enables greater control to modify, change, add specific capabilities and share. Firmware ownership allows them to also own their platform updates, add unique features and more quickly address firmware-based vulnerabilities and security threats.
Open-source firmware requires a community ecosystem to ensure collaboration and freedom to innovate. With AMI’s open-source foundational technology, we are committed to building a community that unleashes innovation and creativity. In addition, customers will have the freedom to use the open base code or leverage additional services around AMI's OpenEdition Power Up, Stay On, and Run Secure solutions.

title: Cost Modeling Analysis for Heterogeneous Integration of Chiplets
description: Key to the decision making on chiplets is whether they make economic sense, which is scenario dependent. There are so many factors to consider and it is sometimes not obvious when and why it makes sense to implement chiplets. A common model for analyzing the cost benefit/trade offs of chiplets can help accelerate that decision making process. Phase 1 of such a model has been developed, which takes into account more than 20+ factors that are pertinent to the trade offs. Additional parameters will also be added in subsequent phases. This is a joint collaboration with Google, ARM and Microchip under the ODSA-Business Workgroup umbrella, with broad inputs from packaging, test equipment and other vendors. The model will be used to show the impact of various parameters on the tradeoffs, which in turn can help practitioners in rapidly iterating to a chiplet solution that is economically and technically viable.

title: Rack Monitoring, Redfish, and OpenBMC
description:
In the latest OCP Rack and Power monitoring spec,  ORV3 Power Monitoring (PMC and PMI) Rev 65, there is no dedicated RMU box in the rack. Data aggregation is offloaded to power systems and security runs on ToR switch. This may not work for ToR-less racks like fabric (network) racks. 

This talk will propose an independent RMU, which will do data aggregation for power devices and anchor security for rack. This RMU can function as a standalone switch or OOB management switch and has flexibility to be used in different configurations (facilities equipment like chillers, generators etc). It has all  functionality supported by current PMC and PMI based design. Power devices send telemetry in Redfish format and RMU aggregates Redfish data and converts to needed format. OpenBMC would aggregate Redfish telemetry and control so Rack monitoring can take full advantage of advancements in Redfish and OpenBMC without another protocol.

title: Securing Private Keys in Edge Datacenters
description:
Software based private key protection is not sufficient, especially for platforms hosted at in Edge datacenters with larger attack surface. Hardware Security Modules (HSM) are good solutions for core PKI infrastructure in datacenter, however they are cost prohibitive, do not scale easily and hence not suitable for every Edge node. 

This talk will cover architecture and implementation of a SGX based key protection for edge platform and integration into platform attestation framework. It will walk through deployment architecture, benefits and details of software implementation and integration with key management services providing end-end confidentiality protection of private keys through life cycle.
social_description: Protect Private Keys on Edge Platforms using SGX
attendees_expected_learnt: Attendees will learn how to use hardware based trusted execution environment to protect private keys on Edge Platforms using Intel SGX. The talk will walk through an overview of SGX TEE and a reference implementation for deployment architecture and available reference code to achieve this goal.

title: Boundary Clocks vs Transparent Clocks in Hyperscale Network
description:
Traditionally, scaling up PTP clock trees was done by Boundary Clocks. Boundary Clocks (BCs) require disruptive modifications in the switch Network Operating System (NOS). Alternatively, Transparent Clocks (TCs) rely solely on the switch ASIC, making TCs easier to implement. 

In addition, features such as error bound benefit the most in pure TC networks. 

In this study we present the implementation of TC in a Switch NOS.
social_description: Scaled up PTP networks benefit by favoring Transparent Clocks over Boundary Clocks
attendees_expected_learnt:
The effects of scaling up PTP clock trees 

Transparent Clocks implementation in Switch NOS and ASICs 

The benefits of Transparent Clocks networks

title: Using Open Interfaces to Advance AI/ML for Networking
description: AI/ML technologies are being widely deployed in a variety of applications but their use within networking itself has been quite limited. Open interfaces and smart feature extraction of the network behavior will enable and boost the usage of AI/ML for networking in disaggregated solutions. This will facilitate the mix & match of networking gear with AI/ML technologies from different entities. In this talk, I will first list several use cases of AI/ML for networking applications and tools to support this functionality such as data reduction techniques that provide flow signatures, with AI engines centralized or on the networking gear. Following, I will share our view on the role of OCP in AI for networking and proposed work that could be done in concert with the SAI WG. In the end, I will showcase a solution for high-rate anomaly detection based on a network providing smart statistics on a group of packets and on a neural network that creates an ensemble of autoencoders.
attendees_expected_learnt:
Attendees can expect to learn:

  • The use cases of artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML) for networking including application classification of encrypted traffic flows, detection of anomalies in traffic patterns indicating security risks and network faults.
  • Data reduction techniques to create flow fingerprinting.
  • Telemetry enhancements to the Switch Abstraction Interface (SAI) that are needed to create an open disaggregated solution between networking devices and AI engines.
  • The results of a study that demonstrates how the above principles can achieve a ML solution that analyzes reduced features extracted from a high rate stream of network packets and identifies network anomalies.

title: ACS Door Heat Exchanger Sub-Project Updates - Requirements, Community Studies & Harmonization
description:
The sub-project is focused on enabling advanced cooling employing door heat exchangers through contribution of reference documentation and community studies. A requirements document to enable Door HX for Open Rack has been contributed. It outlined primary parameters of interest such as performance, physical interfaces, monitoring/control, etc.

Current focus is on studying performance limitations of different solutions as a function of facility boundary conditions. This will evaluate solutions based on facility (air-cooled or facility water) and determine crossover points based on rack power and density. There is a strong benefit to adopting Door HXs beyond their traditional use-case and believe this study will help potential adopters find solutions for future hardware irrespective of facility type.

This talk will cover above details, in addition to harmonization efforts. We hope to receive feedback and solicit topics for future work.
social_description: This presentation will outline completed and on-going efforts in the ACS Door HX sub-project
attendees_expected_learnt:
Attendees can expect to leave with following takeaways:

  • The requirements document should enable potential adopters take advantage of Open Rack v3's advanced cooling readiness by combining Door HX with blind-mate interfaces and in-rack CDU/RPU - enabling high-density cooling
  • The on-going study will also provide potential adopters solution to both stretch existing air-cooled facilities (and enable high-power devices) as well as maximize density with facility water
  • Harmonization efforts with sister groups

title: P4 Integrated Network Stack (PINS)
description: PINS (P4 Integrated Network Stack), is a P4Runtime (P4RT) based network switch stack built on top of the SONiC framework. The PINS stack combines the benefits of the SDN controller with SONiC and brings optionality to SDN networking. P4Runtime for SONiC is opt-in, has standard interfaces, enables rapid innovation, provides automated validation and serves as unambiguous documentation of the switch pipeline. A canonical family of P4 programs (included in the repository) documents the packet forwarding pipeline of SAI. Remote SDN controllers will use these P4 programs to control the switch forwarding behavior over the P4RT API. This presentation will cover the architecture, the high level design and the various supplementary features the team has implemented as part of the stack. We will also discuss in detail some of the use cases that are enabled by the PINS stack.
social_description: PINS brings the benefits of SDN to SONiC.. This presentation provides an introduction.

title: Expo Hall Talk - Spotlight: Data Center Sustainability - Presented by Vertiv
description:
Conversations around efficiency and utilization in data centers are evolving to reflect a more comprehensive, aggressive focus on sustainability. This movement recognizes the urgency of the climate crisis, the relationship between resource availability and rising costs, and shifting politics around the world. The world's largest data center operators are establishing bold sustainability goals and turning to equipment providers, including Vertiv, to make them a reality. It's not about buying renewable energy to offset grid draws; these are difference-making targets focused on transitioning completely to renewable energy and carbon-free or -negative operations, in some cases as early as 2025. 

We see a two-stage sustainability strategy emerging for data center operators. Stage 1: Match energy use with 100% renewable energy. Stage 2: operate 24/7 on carbon-free energy generated locally at the data center. This presentation looks at that strategy in detail and explains why traditional approaches to energy efficiency can't meet today's aggressive sustainability goals.

speakers.bio:
Fred Rebarber, Sr. Technical Director, Thermal Solutions, VERTIV

In his role as Sr. Technical Director, Thermal Solutions, Fred serves as the corporate technical interface for large end-users and consulting engineers who specialize in mission critical thermal designs. A key function of this role is to provide input on product development based on customer needs and market demands. In his previous role in the OEM group, Fred worked with OEMs and end-users to gain adoption of existing Liebert Products as well as create specifications for new products. Before his OEM role, Fred was Director of Sales and Marketing for Cooligy. Cooligy designed and manufactured chip level liquid cooling solutions for OEMs. Fred holds a Bachelor of Science Degree in Mechanical Engineering from the University of California at Berkeley.

title: Expo Hall Talk - The DAC Tax : Why 800G & 112G/lane is the end of the road for passive copper - Presented by Credo
description: With each generation of network speeds, the reach of passive copper cables (DACs) have been decreasing at the same time that their cost and thickness have been increasing. This falling utility has led to the adoption of active interconnect (optics or AECs) in an increasing % of switch ports with DACs now primarily used for NIC-TOR applications. At 112G/lane, a new factor is added – a tax on the cost of the switch to support DACs via a CR compliant port – this tax increases the cost of that switch by 20%and increases the power per port by 100% driven by those power-hungry 112G/lane LR serdes. When combined with 800G cables that are as thick as a garden hose and can no longer be routed at a useful density you reach a clear conclusion – DACs drive an unacceptable tax into the switch which is no longer justified by their  alling utility. 112G/lane is the end of the road for DACs.

title: Creating the Sustainable Datasphere
description:
As data consumption grows companies must employ strategies and technologies to make the most of existing storage devices through reducing drive failures, reselling and repurposing used drives and efficiently recycling components including rare earth metals at end of life.  Seagate proposes a vision towards are more sustainable and circular data economy through use of technologies and best practices.   

Data growth is projected to reach 175ZB in 2025 compared to 33ZB in 2018 with a CAGR of 25% through 2030.  This creates challenges for meeting sustainability targets as it requires massive growth in physical infrastructure.

 Data Security assurances are critical to ensuring drives can be recycled or repurposed.  Technologies such as Instant Secure Erase, Self-Encrypting drives and use of manifests are critical to meeting both data security and sustainability requirements.
social_description: Seagate shares its vision of a sustainable datasphere.
attendees_expected_learnt:
In this talk you will learn about:

  • The impact of the data explosion on sustainability
  • Technologies for safely retiring and recycling hard disk drives
  • The TCO benefits of good storage circularity practices.
  • Resources for creating sustainable data practices.

track.name: EW: 2021 Strategic Initiatives
track.description:
This track includes all 2021 Strategic Initiatives.

Sustainability and Test & Validation

There are 2 key work-streams being developed under this Strategic Initiative: Lifecycle of Systems/Components and Metrics. OCP is looking for solutions to support these two work-streams as well as any new relevant technologies that may provide insights for re-usability and assessment of environmental impact.

title: Hardware Management Project Update
description: Hardware management project provides a common foundation for manageability to a number of OCP projects including servers, storage, data center facility, rack, and power. The hardware management project’s scope and charter have further expanded in the past year. This talk will provide an overview of hardware management project and summarize the current status of its sub-projects: OpenRMC, Hardware Management Module, Hardware Fault Management, and Device Manager. This talk will also provide an update on the baseline profile usage guide and the incorporation of hardware management in the OCP platform design specification.
social_description: This talk provides an overview of Hardware Management Project.
attendees_expected_learnt: The attendees should be able to understand hardware management project's scope, charter, and current status.

title: Immersion Cooling- Equipment Certification approach and Safety Compliance
description:
Provide a perspective from industry safety compliance standpoint and would cover considerations and rationale for certification in three areas 

1) Immersion cooling cabinet

2) Insulation liquid specifically used for this application 

3) Considerations for the IT equipment that would immersed 

IT devices normally follow the compliance path for safety under industry recognized standard, IEC/UL 62368-1 . Recently, the technical committee overseeing the standard has recognized the need to further establish safety criteria for this emerging platform. The presentation will cover these topics, as well as certification approach that UL has developed that can lead to a UL certification , including the system cabinet as well as the insulating liquid. Presentation intends to contribute UL’s knowledge in compliance as it relates to immersion cooling to the members of Open Compute Project
social_description: Immersion devices can follow same recognized standard as IT devices (IEC/UL 62368-1) with added cons
attendees_expected_learnt: Audience will learn the safety certification path and key requirements for immersion cooling equipment under IEC/UL 62368-1. They will also gain knowledge on some of the critical rationale behind it including any additional consideration based on this new platform. The information intends to provide product designer with compliance information that will help align product design efforts and compliance efforts towards minimizing delays in launching immersion cooling products.

track.name: EW: Cooling Environments
track.description: This track is a combo crossover track between Rack and Power (ACS) and Data Center Facilities (ACF).

title: Stateful & Stateless Telemetry
description: The SAI project has evolved significantly over the last few years and many advanced features such as streaming telemetry, event monitoring, and latency monitoring are now supported in SAI TAM spec. Some of these features support stateful and stateless variants. There are definite advantages with stateful monitoring done inside the silicon but in some cases stateless monitoring capabilities are also deployed. In this session, first we will explain MSDC use cases for stateless and stateful monitoring scenarios. We will then present packet drop monitoring and latency monitoring features in detail for both scenarios along with scale related aspects.

title: Hardware Utilization Effectiveness (HUE)
description: In this talk, Meta will propose a new metric, Hardware Utilization Effectiveness (HUE). HUE is to IT equipment what PUE (Power Utilization Effectiveness) is to data centers by evaluating how well IT equipment utilizes the power it receives as a ratio between total power input and useful IT power. HUE is designed to be universally applicable across all IT gear and calculable at scales from individual servers up to a full data center. During this presentation, HUE shall be further explained in comparison to PUE, Meta case studies, and insights around optimization. HUE based calculation can become an effective standard metric to drive OCP sustainability efforts.  We will also discuss how OCP can use this novel measurement based on IT gear to drive industry towards efficiency and long-term sustainability.
social_description: Hardware Utilization Effectiveness (HUE) a is new metric to evaluate IT equipment power efficiency
attendees_expected_learnt: During this presentation, attendees shall expect to learn more about the problem statements and motivation behind the newly proposed Hardware Utilization Effectiveness (HUE) metric. HUE shall be compared with existing industry established metrics such as Power Utilization Effectiveness (PUE), review Meta case studies, and insights around optimization opportunities.

track.name: EW: 2021 Strategic Initiatives
track.description:
This track includes all 2021 Strategic Initiatives.

Sustainability and Test & Validation

There are 2 key work-streams being developed under this Strategic Initiative: Lifecycle of Systems/Components and Metrics. OCP is looking for solutions to support these two work-streams as well as any new relevant technologies that may provide insights for re-usability and assessment of environmental impact.

title: Liquid Cooling: Drivers, timelines and a case for industrial convergence on coolant temperatures
description:
Across industry, a large number of users and partners have accumulated significant experience to develop and enable liquid cooling for those platforms. However, more forward-looking preparation and community collaboration would be needed to make sure they can be deployed at scale, delivering required performance, at desired efficiency and with the right data center infrastructure design.

In this presentation, we will share our vision for thermal support of future ML hardware and Network hardware, at infrastructure level and chip level. We will also share our analysis based on a certain set of assumptions, and the alignment we are hoping to reach on coolant temperature.
attendees_expected_learnt: Foreseeable hardware product trend that demands liquid cooling. Analysis of different options. Need of industrial alignment on coolant temperature.

title: Expo Hall Talk - Memory Forest Initiative: Creating ESG Values in the Data Era - Presented by SK Hynix
description: As the world evolves towards a data-centric society at an accelerating speed, the entire ICT industry now faces the challenge of providing environmentally and socially sustainable system solutions, while still continuing to scale system performance. In this presentation, SK hynix’s new Memory Forest initiative is introduced, where its goal is to create “Memory for the Environment (E), Society (S), and Tomorrow (T)” (Memory ForEST), together with our customers and ecosystem partners. The values of E, S, and T can be achieved using high performance-per-watt memory solutions such as DDR5, HBM3, and CXL, and through local computation techniques such as near-data processing, processing-in-memory, and in-storage processing. Through a combination of these Memory Forest solutions and open innovation, we are committed to helping create eco-friendly datacenters for our customers.

title: Attenuating Acoustic Effects on HDD Performance
description: As Hard Disk Drive (HDD) areal density has grown, increasing the Tracks Per Inch (TPI), the ability of the HDD servo system to filter out external vibrations becomes increasingly more difficult.  The external vibrations can come from the traditionally known chassis operational vibrations, drive to drive interactions, buzzers, nearby equipment, and many other sources.  Acoustics transmitted from Air Moving Devices (AMDs) operating at high speeds, though, have become a much bigger factor in the performance of HDDs.  Testing was completed to evaluate the benefits of a blower compared to the usually used axial fan in a high density storage system.  The blower is sized to fit into the same slot as the axial fan.  The HDD performance and system cooling ability between the two AMDs were compared and it was found that the blowers affected the HDD performance less than the axial fans for the same cooling effect.
social_description: Optimize cooling for HDDs to limit vibration and enable high capacity and low $/TB storage.
attendees_expected_learnt:
To explore alternate air cooling technologies that avoid HDD performance degradation at the same or increased cooling requirements, especially in high power and/or high density storage enclosures.

Encourage system developers to examine and evaluate blowers for cooling, which may then help create a larger market that would reduce costs and provide more blowers that would work for high density storage enclosures.

Mike Raineri is a Senior Principal Software Engineer at Dell Inc., where he is a technical leader for enclosure management solutions for storage appliances within the Dell EMC Infrastructure Solutions Group.

Mike has been working in the storage industry for the since 2007 as part of EMC, and now Dell EMC, where he has been involved in the architecture and the development of hardware diagnostic test suites, UEFI applications, and BMC firmware. These roles have allowed him to collaborate over a large spectrum of consumers, from the lowest level manufacturing processes to end clients.

Mike has been involved within the DMTF for several years now. He was elected to be the co-chair of the Redfish Forum in 2017 for continuing the development and adoption of the Redfish standard.

title: Qarnot and ITRenew collaboration on OCP ready heat recovery system solution
description:
OCP   brings the best technology design ideas together to address growing   infrastructure demands. Qarnot and ITRenew are collaborating to adapt OCP   designs in ways that mitigate environmental impact and make the IT industry   more sustainable. 

Qarnot   is a company that recovers and reuses the heat generated by servers to warm   buildings. ITRenew is a global leader in data center circularity,   transforming decommissioned hyperscale technology into efficient compute,   storage and networking solutions that eliminate eWaste and pre-use phase   carbon. There is an obvious synergy in the way both companies are turning   potential sources of waste into valuable assets, and opportunity to apply   this collective expertise to the challenge of sustainably scaling OCP   adoption.
attendees_expected_learnt:
•  How the OCP platform design is attractive for heat recovery
  • What were the technical challenges in adapting to the Qarnot deployment models
  •  What are the positive and negative aspects of the OCP server design for lifecycle extension
  • Why OCP recertified equipment is interesting for heat reuse
  • What improvements could be considered for future OCP designs to make them more suitable for the circular economy and heat recovery

track.name: EW: 2021 Strategic Initiatives
track.description:

There are 2 key work-streams being developed under this Strategic Initiative: Lifecycle of Systems/Components and Metrics. OCP is looking for solutions to support these two work-streams as well as any new relevant technologies that may provide insights for re-usability and assessment of environmental impact.

title: OCP Server DeltaLake OSF RAS Features
description:
This presentation will demonstrate how to download the code based on OCP OSF submission, build and flash the OSF image for OCP Delta Lake, and the VPD variables for your server customizations. Also it will go over the OCP OSF checklist, feature list and high level test plan.

BtG, Client and Server TXT Technologies are fused together into a single technology, allowing them to  mutually benefit, avoid conflicts, and remove duplication of tasks. The presentation is about how CBnT works in general, our way to integrate this into coreboot and what was needed to achieve this.

Reliability, availability, and serviceability (RAS) are a combination of hardware features to detect, log and remediate system errors. The machine check architecture (MCA) is used to understand correctable and uncorrectable errors across memory, PCIE and CPU. Coreboot plays an important role in the initialization of MCA and runtime handling of error events.
attendees_expected_learnt: This presentation will demonstrate how to download the code based on OCP OSF submission, build and flash the OSF image for OCP Delta Lake, and the VPD variables for your server customizations. Also it will go over the OCP OSF checklist, feature list and high level test plan.  This presentation will also provide information on the various components of CBnT, RAS and integration with open source firmware Coreboot.

title: Radio Cloud OpenEdge Server Design
description:
Nokia and ASUS have jointly developed a new 2nd generation Open Edge server sled featuring support for 3rd Generation Intel® Xeon® Scalable Processors. This presentation highlights the main technical specifications of this server. The 2nd generation Open Edge server is a major advancement over the initial Open Edge server release of 2018. 

The main enhancement is the introduction of support for 3rd Generation Intel® Xeon® Scalable Processor family CPUs and EDSFF E1.S with forward-looking SSD technology.  The new CPU generation and several other improvements bring significant benefits in running various real-time applications at the edge. Improved system cooling will enable simultaneous use of higher TDP CPUs and various accelerator cards.
attendees_expected_learnt: This presentation highlights the main technical specifications of this server. The 2nd generation Open Edge server is a major advancement over the initial Open Edge server release of 2018.

title: FBOSS Experience of Migrating Massive Scale Networking Systems to SAI
description: FBOSS is Meta's own software stack for controlling/managing network switches deployed in Meta's Data Centers. It is one of the largest services in Meta in terms of the number of instances deployed. These switches contain Network processors (NPU) and optionally Physical Layer devices (PHY) which are managed by the vendor provided SDK. This talk will share our experience migrating non-greenfield massive scale production deployment from FBOSS non-SAI implementation to FBOSS SAI based implementation.
attendees_expected_learnt:
We will focus on:

  • FBOSS push infra changes to build a parallel qualification pipeline to validate and rollout FBOSS SAI implementation. 
  • Subtle bugs that can only be found in production despite a large test suite.
  • Rolling out fixes to mitigate/fix the issues discovered during the production deployment
  • Advantage and challenges of moving PHY management to SAI based SDK

title: OCP Ready Guidelines for Deploying Modular Data Centers
description:
The OCP Modular Data Center subproject is in the process of developing guidelines for deploying modular data centers.  The intent is to provide guidance for designers, manufacturers, and specifiers of modular/prefabricated data center (MDC) solutions utilizing Open Compute Project Open Racks.  The completed document will contain information outlining considerations and options for the electrical, cooling, and rack infrastructure for optimum modular/prefabricated design.  If implemented by the MDC solution provider, the OCP user would realize the full benefits of the various Open Rack designs.  

The session will be a panel discussion to present an overview of the guideline, review the current status, and outline next steps for expansion and revisions.
attendees_expected_learnt: An overview of the OCP-Modular Data Center subproject's plan to advance the use of MDC's via creation of the deployment guideline.

title: Developing tools and methods to quantify carbon emissions over hardware life-cycles
description: To address ICT’s growing carbon emissions, it is crucial to enable computer systems engineers and researchers to assess optimization paths to balance performance, efficiency, and carbon footprint. This requires accurate, accessible, and extensible data and models to quantify the footprint of systems. Meta AI Research is developing tools and methods to quantify the footprint of computer systems over their lifetime. This presentation shares the lessons learned in building models to quantify emissions from manufacturing and use. We highlight state-of-the-art knowledge available in open-source component-level life-cycle analyses, and sustainability literature across industry and academia. Using an example Yosemite v3 Life Cycle Assessment (LCA), we show the gap in open-source tools and LCA’s, which require significant time and resources. The case study is used to identify paths ahead for the community to accelerate research and development in reducing ICT emissions.
social_description: We share the lessons learned in modeling emissions from ICT manufacturing and use.
attendees_expected_learnt:
In this presentation attendees can expect to learn: 

  • Importance of data and models for assessing the carbon footprint of ICT across hardware life cycles
  • Availability of publicly accessible carbon footprint data and models 
  • How such data and models can be used by computer systems researchers and developers to assess optimization paths balancing performance, efficiency, and carbon footprint
  • On-going efforts at Meta AI Research on developing tools and methods to quantify footprint of computer systems over their lifetime
  • Future paths ahead for the sustainability community to address, accelerating research and development in reducing ICT emissions

speakers.title: Visiting AI Researcher
speakers.bio: Udit Gupta is a PhD student in CS at Harvard University and visiting researcher at Facebook AI Research. He received his B.S. in ECE from Cornell University in 2016. His research interests focus on improving the performance and energy efficiency of emerging applications in computer systems and architecture by co-designing solutions across the computing stack. His recent work explores the characterization and optimization of at-scale deployment of deep learning based personalized recommendation systems, as well as investigates the design of sustainable computer systems by taking into account emissions across entire hardware life-cycles.

speakers.title: Applied Research Scientist
speakers.bio: Carole-Jean Wu is a Research Scientist at Facebook AI Research. Her research focus lies in the domain of computer system architecture with particular emphasis on energy- and memory-efficient systems. Her research has pivoted into designing systems for machine learning execution at-scale. In general, she is interested in tackling system challenges to enable efficient, responsible AI execution. Carole-Jean chairs the MLPerf Recommendation Benchmark Advisory Board, co-chaired MLPerf Inference, and serves on the MLCommons Board as a director. She received her M.A. and Ph.D. from Princeton and B.Sc. from Cornell.

title: Expo Hall Talk - How Hardware-Accelerated Data Shaping and Placement Can Transform Your Cloud Infrastructure - Presented by Pliops
description:
Cloud operators are inundated with data at an unprecedented pace and require faster access to it so they can turn that data into opportunities. To not only keep up, but lead in data storage and processing, cloud operators must boldly pursue novel solutions that allow them to do more with less while advancing scalability, performance, and reliability.   Distributed file systems, disaggregated architecture, and persistent media advancements are just part of the innovations that have enabled the data revolution, but their inherent limitations are not efficiently keeping up with today’s demand, let alone tomorrow’s.
A new architecture has emerged using function-specific hardware-acceleration technology to shape data for optimal placement on low cost, high capacity QLC SSDs. Data shaping combined with inline transparent compression and advanced data protection enables cloud operators to build cost-effective, scalable, and resilient high-performing storage nodes that   propel critical data into insights and opportunities.

title: Autonomous Drive Regeneration
description: Recent HDD generations optimized capacity and cost by increasing the numbers of heads and media in a device, and consequently a certain head represents a decreasing proportion of the overall device capacity.  Since most field failures occur due to a single head failure, continued use of the drive is of great interest to the storage industry to recover from events associated with only a single head while remaining drive capacity persists to be functional and reliable.  Techniques supporting swap avoidance, including Storage Element Depopulation, have been developed and made available to the industry.  In this paper we discuss the benefits of using such techniques for storage fleet health maintenance and propose wider and more rapid adoption of such techniques.
attendees_expected_learnt: The benefits of adopting techniques for storage fleet health maintenance through swap avoidance, and the reasons behind them.

title: Intel CycloneV-Based RunBMC Solution Update
description: OCP RunBMC standard has been the first definition of modular BMC approach developed under HW Management Project. Intel has developed the first FPGA SoC based RunBMC module with Intel Cyclone V running OpenBMC FW stack coupled with Intel MAX10 which is providing a security and Root Of Trust. The FPGA SoC based solution allows for improved flexibility, innovation, and scalability. It also allows for in-field patching of manageability HW through RTL bitstream updates. This is essential benefit especially for security vulnerabilities that are originated in the HW. The first prototype of Intel® Cyclone V RunBMC module has been presented at 2020 OCP Virtual Summit. Since then Intel has been working on improved and updated version of the module which is also planned to be contributed to OCP. In this presentation we are going to provide an update on the changes done in the second version of Intel Cyclone V RunBMC and OCP design contribution readiness status including OpenBMC FW support.
social_description: The 2nd version of Intel® Cyclone V RunBMC and OCP design contribution readiness status.
attendees_expected_learnt: Intel has developed first implementation or OCP RunBMC standard based on FPGA SoC which allows for developing Robust RTL but also allows for more rapid innovation of new management and security features which are critical in improving the robustness of BMC and Security Technologies. After 2020 OCP Virtual Summit presentation of first prototype we have received strong interest in this concept from multiple OCP members and partners that wanted to get more details regarding plans and design details. Attendees will be able to learn about changes and improvements done in the second version of the Intel® Cyclone V RunBMC module. We will also provide an update on the design contribution readiness and OpenBMC FW enabling for Intel® Cyclone V RunBMC module.

title: Yosemite v1 Mono Lake Platform Enablement - “Open All The Way Down”
description:
Sri and Jay will talk about the body of work that went into enabling the OCP Mono Lake high-density single-socket server platform transform it from a platform meant for hyperscaling to a general-purpose platform that opens possibilities in datacenter, edge, and so many others.

The effort to open the platform was not trivial. Sri and Jay will address the challenges of opening a platform which there are many areas of work to be done from the host firmware to coreboot and more. That look back will be followed with a conversation about what the platform can do today, including time to garner feedback and comments from the community.
social_description: Hear about trials & tribulations opening a platform where we deal with challenges of host firmware.
attendees_expected_learnt: The OCP community will learn about the effort that has gone into opening the Mono Lake platform, the current state of progress, and how we can make the Mono Lake platform an example of the value of OCP to the rest of the world.

title: OCP Design for Circularity Guide
description:
The OCP Sustainability Lifecycles workstream is developing a Design for Circularity guide, intended to be an industry standard that outlines actionable steps that can be taken during the design process to increase a product’s circularity and sustainability. This presentation will:

1. Share the goals of the Design for Circularity guide

   a.  Align the hyperscale hardware ecosystem on a actionable set of items that can be implemented in products to reduce their environmental impact

   b.  Provide a foundation for easy-to-communicate performance indicators (bronze, silver, gold)

2. Invite additional OCP stakeholder participation in the development process

   a. Solicit contribution of internal design for circularity guides or metrics from OCP community members

   b. Expand the community members involved in the development process
attendees_expected_learnt:
Attendees will learn:

  1. The goals and current/ planned work of an OCP Design for Circularity guide
  2. How the OCP Design for Circularity guide will increase circularity and sustainability of products
  3. How to become involved in the development process


This is a group submission from the OCP Lifecycles Workstream, including SDIA, RISE, Sims Lifecycle Services, Intel, Memorial University of Newfoundland, Mayur Sen, ITRenew, and Meta.

track.name: EW: 2021 Strategic Initiatives
track.description:
This track includes all 2021 Strategic Initiatives.

Sustainability and Test & Validation

There are 2 key work-streams being developed under this Strategic Initiative: Lifecycle of Systems/Components and Metrics. OCP is looking for solutions to support these two work-streams as well as any new relevant technologies that may provide insights for re-usability and assessment of environmental impact.

title: OAI Cooling and OAMTool update
description:
The OAI Cooling workstream has been exploring the design practice and implementation considerations of liquid cooling for AI platforms. In first part of this presentation, we will briefly walk through our progress, a few challenges we observed, and how we want the broader OCP community to help on.

OAMTool is a vendor-agnostic utility for OAM management. We introduced the OAMTool initiative at the OCP Global Summit in March 2020. Second part of this talk will give an update on the development of OAMTool since then. We will focus on the OAMTool specification update and the Phase 1 features status. We will also introduce new OAM vendors and users who have joined the effort.
attendees_expected_learnt: Design practices and learnings from studies contributed by system integrator and solution providers on a hypothetic system based on UBB and OAM.

title: Expo Hall Talk - TRIM performance optimizations and Metrics used on KIOXIA Data Center SSDs enabled through the OCP Datacenter NVMe SSD Specification - Presented by KIOXIA
description: OCP Datacenter NVMe SSD Specification offers opportunities for enhanced Dataset Management Deallocation (aka trim) performance with reduced   latency distributions over standard NVMe Devices. This paper will examine how KIOXIA leveraged OCP specification optimizations to create a hyperscaler optimized   XD6 SSD with >10TB/2 trim bandwidth. This paper will also explore opportunities for enhanced trim metrics that could be published through OCP heading forward.

title: Aptio OpenEdition: Holistic UEFI Solutions for the Open-source Ecosystem
description: In May 2021, AMI announced its contribution of Aptio OpenEdition™ UEFI BIOS Firmware source code to the Open Compute Foundation. As a new OCP Contributor, AMI’s objectives are to drive the industry forward, encourage broader adoption of industry-standard solutions and harness a respected platform to provide innovations back to the Community. AMI sees tremendous benefits in the new model it has created for open- source firmware, with the promise of increased security, transparency, and reliability. This presentation will introduce attendees to a holistic open-source firmware development and adoption process, outlining key areas of interest to all ecosystem stakeholders. As a global leader in firmware development with over 35 years of experience, AMI will highlight the benefits it sees ahead for the entire ecosystem of OCP Approved™ and OCP Inspired™ vendors, circular economy champions and the OCP end user Community adopting these solutions.
social_description: New OCP Contributor AMI embraces open-source firmware for holistic benefits across the OCP ecosystem
attendees_expected_learnt: This presentation will introduce attendees to a holistic opensource firmware development and adoption process, outlining key areas of interest to all ecosystem stakeholders. As a global leader in firmware development with over 35 years of experience, AMI will highlight the benefits it sees ahead for the entire ecosystem of OCP Approved™ and OCP Inspired™ vendors, circular economy champions and the OCP end user Community adopting these solutions.

title: OCP NIC 3.0 Management with NC-SI 1.2
description: OCP NIC 3.0 specification has been widely adopted by the OCP community and industry at large. OCP NIC 3.0 manageability features leverage DMTF PMCI specifications including Network Controller Sideband Interface (NC-SI). NC-SI 1.2 is the latest version of the NC-SI specification. In this talk, we will provide an overview of NC-SI 1.2 features and their applicability to OCP NIC 3.0.
social_description: This talk summarizes new features in NC-SI 1.2 and their applicability to OCP NIC 3.0.
attendees_expected_learnt: The attendees should expect to learn about new NC-SI 1.2 features and how they apply to OCP NIC 3.0.

speakers.title: Distinguished Engineer and Architect
speakers.bio: Hemal Shah is a Distinguished Engineer and architect in the Data Center Solutions Group (DCSG) division at Broadcom Inc. He leads and manages a team of architects. Hemal is responsible for the definition of Ethernet NIC product architecture and software roadmap/architecture of server and client Ethernet NIC product lines. Hemal spearheaded the development of TruFlowTM technology for vSwitch acceleration/packet processing frameworks, TruManageTM technology for system and network management, security features, virtualization and stateless offloads. Before joining Broadcom, Hemal worked at Intel Corporation where he led the development of system/silicon/software architecture of communication processors, 10G Ethernet controllers, TCP/iSCSI/RDMA offloads, and IPsec/SSL/firewall/VPN accelerations. Hemal serves as Senior VP of Tech in the DMTF and a project co-lead of OCP Hardware Management project.

speakers.title: Distinguished Member of the Technical Staff
speakers.bio: Bob Stevens is a Distinguished Member of the Technical Staff and Systems Management Architect at DellEMC.  He is responsible for defining the systems management support of Ethernet, Fibre Channel, and InfiniBand Communications controllers and Accelerator adapters including FPGA and GPGPUs.  Bob is a technical representative/contributor from DellEMC in the Open Compute Project (OCP) and Distributed Management Task Force (DMTF).  In OCP he is the co-lead of the HW Management Project and has been active in the OCP NIC 3.0 subgroup, contributing to the systems management and FRU areas of the specification.  In the DMTF, Bob has served as Dell’s primary representative to the PMCI working group for the past 14 years.  He chaired the NIC Sideband Interface Sub Team which developed the NC-SI specification and has been the editor or co-editor of all of its versions.

title: Data Center and Sustainability, the Future is Now.
description:
The data center industry continues to grow and consume more and more energy and natural resources. It is estimated that US data centers, alone, consumed approximately 73 billion kWh in 2020. As a result, there is an unique opportunity and social responsibility to deliver solutions that improve environmental performance. Inaction could have direct business consequences.

Hear how Meta, whose mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together, is addressing these opportunities—first hand. You’ll also hear how Alfa Laval, a leading global supplier of products and solutions for heat transfer, separation and fluid handling, is tackling these issues as well.

Join us for a stimulating conversation to understand how each company, in their respective fields, is seeking to lead the global data center industry with a commitment to sustainability and market-based solutions to solve these pressing environmental challenges.
social_description: Meta. Alfa Laval. Leading the way and addressing Sustainability of data centers today
attendees_expected_learnt:
Upon completion of this session attendees will

  • Understand how to make data centers more sustainable and lessen their controversial impact on communities
  • Understand how to improve cooling efficiency and water savings, while further reducing environmental impact with technology you might have today
  • Understand how circular economy can be applied in data centers

title: Preparing Meta For Growing Power Demand: Thermal Perspective
description: The next gen training cluster racks are pushing the limits of air-cooling at device level and transitioning the architecture towards liquid cooling at rack scale. As we increase the rack airflow limits while maintaining existing data center(DC) designs, there is potential risk to thermal health and DC efficiency due to an undesirable thermal phenomena called hot air recirculation. Such trends call for re-evaluation of existing data center designs and its current design guidelines. DC systems thermal analysis is a connecting link to successfully integrate the high CFM and high power racks into data halls while ensuring overall thermal health of our IT. In this study, we identified constraints associated with system level airflow behavior that influence the rack deployment. It also aims to resolve the recirculation problems by implementing varied strategies including DC spatial redesign, targeted rack design modification and an overall systems risk modeling framework.
attendees_expected_learnt: Attendees can learn the thermal challenges that need to be addressed when we deploy the high power racks at data center level. The study demonstrates the approach taken in anticipating and resolving the unexpected thermal impact high power racks could have on the overall performance and reliability risks of the hardware. The work also gives audience insight into how Meta takes proactive approach to mitigate unforeseen operational inefficiencies as we design to scale.

title: SAI pipeline enhancements with Pre-Ingress ACL and MyMAC Station Stages and Enhanced FEC Modes for High Speed, 200G and Above Ports
description:
This session will cover SAI pipeline enhancements and use-case discussion for MYMAC station and pre-Ingress ACL stages along with the need for FEC mode enhancements for high-speed ports (200G and beyond).

Pre L3 ACL stage of SAI pipeline consists of intelligent protocol-aware selector (QSET), lookup engine (ACL), and action resolution engine. This stage can be used to setup up the policy based VRF for multi-tenant isolation, vlan modifications, assigning aggregate group id etc. MYMAC table is a new stage in SAI pipeline that qualifies the packet for layer 2 or layer 3 processing. The additional FEC controls allow application-level control of the FEC modes used in PAM4 links.
attendees_expected_learnt: This topic will explain the need of pre-ingress ACL stage in SAI pipeline, its use cases and SAI workflow

title: A Framework For Upgrading Whitebox Firmware in a Distributed Disaggregated Chassis Implementation from a Service Provider Perspective
description:
In implementing a DDC solution for different use cases within AT&T, one of the challenge that needed to be solved was the firmware and software release synchronization and management and how to upgrade the firmware components on the whitebox in such a manner that meets the operational objectives of service provider operational team.

Diversity Challenge within a DDC implementation:

1. Whiteboxes can come from different ODMs each with its own method of upgrading the firmware components.

2. Different NOS, built on different architecture and linux branches have different approach to upgrading firmware.

3.  NOC Operation team wants fast upgrades and one command upgrade regardless of the variety of components within a DDC.
attendees_expected_learnt: This presentation presents a compromised approach to address the complexity of managing and upgrading firmware for whitebox components within a DDC implementation.  This framework was achieved by AT&T in working in close partnership with ODMs - UFI and Accton and NOS - DriveNets and Cisco partners to meet the requirements and objectives of our operational team.  This approach is equally applicable to stand alone whitebox implementation and it is hope that the industry will adopt this approach  for upgrading whitebox firmware.

title: OCP NVMe HDD Specification
description: NVMe HDDs are a lot closer than you might think! We will cover the work that has been done over the past year in the NVMe HDD workstream and share the draft specification that will define the next evolution of hard disk drives. We will cover the connector, key signals, critical feature requirements, security, and much more.
social_description: NVMe HDDs - draft specification overview and ecosystem enablement.
attendees_expected_learnt: Join this presentation to get the latest on the OCP NVMe HDD specification, and see why this is poised to replace both SATA and SAS while enabling the next evolution of HDDs. We will cover the physical aspects from the formfactor, power, and connector to new security features and system considerations.

title: PANEL: Data Center Liquid Distribution  Guidance & Reference Designs
description: Adding, changing liquid cooled ITE is becoming a standard requirement in data center life cycle operations.  The inherent risk and cost of adding liquid distribution in an operating data center can be greatly reduced by employment of reference designs and collaborative development of best practices and common procedures.
social_description: Review of reference designs and global best practices in addition of liquid cooled ITE
attendees_expected_learnt:
Key topics to include

Design Considerations

Case 1- Addition to existing Facility Water System (Chiller Plant Loop)

  • · Planning FWS  Pipe Connections
  • · Pipe Route Planning & reference designs
  • · CDU Planning
  • · Service Level Agreement (SLA) Considerations
  • · Risk & Reliability Considerations- Myth Vs Reality
  • · Concurrent Maintainability

Case 2 - Addition to Elevated Temperature Loop (no Chiller Plant)

Virtual Design & Construction Enablement of Liquid Cooled ITE in Data Center Life-Cycle

title: PANEL: Open and Interoperable AI Training Clusters
description: This submission is for a panel discussion around Open and Interoperable AI Training Clusters. Over the past few years, the community has embraced Open accelerator infrastructure successfully around efforts such as OAM and UBB. AI Training as a solution requires significant interoperability at the cluster level to deliver the solution. Hence, having open and interoperable hardware of the key AI Training cluster ingredients with ecosystem support is both a natural and a necessary progression of the Open Accelerator Infrastructure efforts. This panel will feature participants from end users, accelerator, network, compute ingredient providers to name a few and discuss both contributions to Open accelerator infrastructure in the past and discuss how we further evolve this as a community towards open and interoperable ecosystem of AI Training Clusters in the future.
attendees_expected_learnt: Attendees will learn about current open accelerator infrastructure efforts at the module and board level and get insight into industry commitment to enabling this at the cluster level.

title: FSP and MinPlatform for Sapphire Rapids Intel® Xeon® Scalable Processors
description:
The Intel® Firmware Support Package (Intel® FSP) is a binary distribution of Intel’s silicon initialization code. All Open System Firmware (OSF) implementations (coreboot, MinPlatform, etc.) that support Intel chipsets utilize the FSP for silicon initialization

The TianoCore MinPlatform project is a lightweight, consistent, and standards-compliant implementation of OSF. MinPlatform is the upstream project which provides the foundation upon which AMI® Aptio OpenEdition™ is built

The presentation will give an overview of FSP and MinPlatform for those in the audience who have not been highly engaged in the OCP OSF project. Then, a brief update on our progress since the last OCP summit will be given, which includes the release of Ice Lake/Cooper Lake and optimizing for Linux Boot. Finally, our future plans for Sapphire Rapids will be discussed, including better support for FSP API mode, increased modularity, and improvements to our open source MinPlatform solution
social_description: An overview of FSP and MinPlatform, our progress thus far, and our future plans for Sapphire Rapids.
attendees_expected_learnt:
• A high level understanding of FSP and MinPlatform; and how they fit into Intel's strategy for enabling OSF.
  • Our recent development progress, which includes:
    • The release of FSP and MinPlatform for Ice Lake and Cooper Lake.
    • Optimizations to make MinPlatform efficiently bootstrap Linux Boot.
    • Increased abstraction in our MinPlatform Advanced Features (easier porting to new SoCs.)
  • Future plans for Sapphire Rapids (4th Gen Xeon® Scalable):
    • Improved support for FSP API mode.
    • More open source advanced features for MinPlatform available out-of-box.
    • Gradual progress on evolving traditional UEFI BIOS towards the lightweight and open MinPlatform design.
  • Intel's goal is that all software runs best on Intel processors. Not just operating systems and applications, different flavors of system firmware included.

track.name: EW: Open System Firmware (OSF)
track.description: An open firmware development project aiming to allow BIOS to be modified and shared by the owners. This project leverages Coreboot/Linux Boot by filling the gaps against UEFI BIOS.

The San Jose McEnery Convention Center sits in the center of Downtown and boasts hundreds of varied events a year. It has been the home for the OCP Global Summit for over 8 years! The 550,000-square-foot facility is the largest convention center in Silicon Valley. It is named after Tom McEnery, a former Mayor of San Jose. San Jose is the first convention center in Northern California to receive the cleaning industry’s only outbreak prevention, response and recovery accreditation. Global Biorisk Advisory Council (GBAC) STAR establishes protocols and procedures, offers expert-led training and assesses a facility’s preparedness for biorisk situations. Every venue that receives the accreditation is vetted by GBAC as meeting all requirements for a safe, preventative, and responsive meetings facility.

title: Rack Management Solution by Wiwynn
description:
Rack management solution by Wiwynn 

Wiwynn implemented a Rack management solution using a proprietary proven stack. Currently, the stack is IPMI 2.0 compliant and supports a wide array of commands to manage up to 5 nodes. In addition to IPMI, Redfish-based management is also being developed. 

In this presentation, we are planning to share:

· System architecture including BOOT UP and SLED discovery.

· Various APIs available to manage the nodes e.g., Sensor reading, PSU Firmware upgrade, power capping, etc.

· A live demo using EP 100 server.
attendees_expected_learnt:
The attendees will learn the following points:

1) Wiwynn's offering on Rack Management solution.

2) How to manage the rack using various APIs supported by the solution?

3) Future roadmap.

track.description:

Includes Sub-Projects: OpenRMC, Hardware Management Module, Hardware Fault Management

title: Life Cycle Assessments for Cloud Hardware: Lessons Learned
description: Life Cycle Assessments is a common practice to understand the environment impact of any product or process. As Microsoft committed to being carbon negative, water positive and zero waste by 2030, we’re using LCAs as one method to understand the impacts from our server hardware and identify opportunities within our hardware design and engineering that will allow us to meet these goals. This session will share lessons learned in conducting LCAs across a few different projects, share insights for others looking to conduct LCAs on cloud hardware and infrastructure and discuss challenges encountered in the process. We hope this session will contribute to OCP’s work to develop a framework around how to do LCAs across our industry to streamline the process and reports enabling cross company comparisons and efficiency across shared suppliers.
social_description: Cloud LCA 101
attendees_expected_learnt:
- What is a Life Cycle Assessment, why are they done and what are they used for

- How to get started doing an LCA for cloud hardware in a large company/organization

- Best practices

track.name: EW: 2021 Strategic Initiatives
track.description:
This track includes all 2021 Strategic Initiatives.

Sustainability and Test & Validation

There are 2 key work-streams being developed under this Strategic Initiative: Lifecycle of Systems/Components and Metrics. OCP is looking for solutions to support these two work-streams as well as any new relevant technologies that may provide insights for re-usability and assessment of environmental impact.

speakers.title: Senior Project Director
speakers.bio: Senior Project Director, Julie Sinistore, leads product sustainability and life cycle assessment (LCA) efforts for WSP’s sustainability, energy and climate change team. Julie has been conducting LCAs in both academic and private consulting settings since 2007 and her expertise includes LCA of products and services and sustainability strategy in the electronics, construction, food, biobased fuels and chemicals and agriculture sectors. title: NG OpenEdge Server design
description:
Nokia has contributed the initial Open edge chassis as OCP accepted product and as part of Open edge solution Nokia has also contributed 1U and 2U server sleds as OCP inspired products already in initial server release of 2018 . 

In this presentation we will describe the key requirements and design concept proposals for future generation(s) of Open Edge server developments to continuously bring significant performance boost in running various real-time applications at the edge.

Key focus in this presentation is show our thinking what is required when target is taking maximum advantage of processor and other semiconductor technology development and at the same time maintain 100% compatibility with other Open Edge ecosystem components like 2U/3U chassis, power supplies, RMC module and other sled types like Open Edge switch sled.
attendees_expected_learnt: Attendees should gain deeper understanding of the requirements for taking maximum advantage of processor and other semiconductor technology while maintaining 100% compatibility with OpenEdge ecosystem components.

title: SAI Challenger: The SONiC-Based Framework for SAI Testing and Integration
description:
With the growing popularity of the disaggregated approach in data center networking, the solution’s quality becomes even more challenging than before. We present a fast, simple, and efficient way to secure the quality of SAI-based solutions. Closely simulating a NOS environment, this test framework uses minimal effort to detect flaws in SAI/SDK effectively regardless of the ASIC vendor. SAI Challenger, an open-source tool developed by PLVision, represents a re-imagined approach for SAI testing, based on SONiC’s native infrastructure. It applies to a wide range of cases, including SAI integration with SONiC, interoperability with external PHYs, and beyond. Some of its beneficial key features include:   

(1) SAI multi-version support; (2) Unit, functional, and integration testing; (3) SAI test cases development in a simulated environment (on top of libsaivs); (3) Gearbox (PHY) SAI testing (work in progress); (4) SAI debugging with redis-cli
social_description: PLVision's open-source framework is a fast, simple way to secure the quality of SAI-based solutions
attendees_expected_learnt: An alternative approach to testing SAI in a SONiC-based environment that ensures quality and reduces time-to-market for the final solution

title: Redfish for Data Center Facilities
description: The Redfish specification and data model has been extended to include data center facility equipment, allowing end users to manage that equipment with the same protocol and tools as the OCP IT gear. New data models either released or in development cover power distribution units, power shelves, UPS (or backup power units), electrical buses, liquid cooled servers, and cooling distribution units. This session will explain the additions to the data model, walk through mockup examples of implementations, and give opportunities to provide feedback on models available as a work-in-progress.
social_description: Redfish support extends coverage to Data Center Facility gear: PDUs, UPSs, and Cooling Units
attendees_expected_learnt: Attendees will learn how the Redfish data model was extended to incorporate DCF equipment, including power distribution equipment, UPS units, liquid cooling systems, and the facility infrastructure. They will learn how the standard can be implemented in OCP products and how end user can utilize open source tools to monitor and manage the data center using common Redfish operations.

track.name: EW: Data Center Facility (DCF)
track.description:
Design, commissioning and operational practice of the data center, power and cooling infrastructure in support if IT equipment, DC infrastructure management.

Includes Sub-Projects: Advanced Cooling Facilities (ACF), Operation Technology Security (OTS), Modular Data Center (MDC)

speakers.title: Distinguished Technologist
speakers.bio:
Jeff Autor is a Distinguished Technologist in the Security and Open Firmware Futures group of Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE).  Over his 30-year career at HPE he has designed and developed systems management technology for HPE server products.  Jeff co-authored the first SNMP server management MIBs, and has been involved in the architecture of numerous Compaq, HP BladeSystem, HPE ProLiant and HPE iLO management technologies.  He has architected and developed manageability solutions including support for SNMP, IPMI and JSON-based RESTful protocols.  He holds 18 patents in the areas of computer system management, hardware abstraction and failover clustering.

Jeff is currently co-Chair of the DMTF's Redfish Forum, which defines the Redfish open industry standard for systems management using modern RESTful-style protocols and developer-friendly data models.

speakers.title: Senior Principal Software Engineer
speakers.bio:
Mike Raineri is a Senior Principal Software Engineer at Dell Inc., where he is a technical leader for enclosure management solutions for storage appliances within the Dell EMC Infrastructure Solutions Group.

Mike has been working in the storage industry for the since 2007 as part of EMC, and now Dell EMC, where he has been involved in the architecture and the development of hardware diagnostic test suites, UEFI applications, and BMC firmware. These roles have allowed him to collaborate over a large spectrum of consumers, from the lowest level manufacturing processes to end clients.

Mike has been involved within the DMTF for several years now. He was elected to be the co-chair of the Redfish Forum in 2017 for continuing the development and adoption of the Redfish standard.

title: Arm and Ampere Support for Standards-Based Open System Firmware
description: The Arm SystemReady compliance certification program defines standards for hardware and firmware to enable operating systems and hypervisors to just work on Arm devices. These standards empower the Arm ecosystem to deliver an interoperable out-of-the-box experience across the market segments. For OCP compliant servers, this includes SystemReady SR (Servers) and LS (LinuxBoot Servers) certification bands. Ampere Computing is delivering successful products that align with Arm SystemReady, as well as the OSP OSF requirements. Ampere recently launched its 80-core Arm64 Altra processor on the Mt. Jade platform, which is the first system to achieve Arm SystemReady SR certification. In this presentation, we will highlight the Arm SystemReady program and the associated server design requirements and discuss development options to enable OSF compliant firmware on Arm servers. We will also cover the status of various open-source firmware projects on Ampere's processors and platforms.
attendees_expected_learnt: Learn about Arm SystemReady LS, and the use of LinuxBoot as an open source firmware  on Arm servers

title: Yosemite V3 SW Management Introduction
description:
Yosemite v3 platform is a multi-node platform with multiple system configurations which enables several expansion options. The expansion board enables YV3 to support multiple config Types (T3, T8, T15, T17., etc). 

How BMC establishes the most effective management method with the BIC and CPLD in the system will affect the efficiency, stability and even the user's usage habits of the system. In terms of component firmware, we make a single version to support multiple configurations, and with this way, it not only makes the management firmware support on the system simpler but also reduces the issues caused by firmware compatibility. 

In addition, we use USB interface instead of traditional i2c interface to update BIOS firmware which increase the firmware update efficiency. 

In the end, we hope through this introduction, people can understand how FB OpenBMC plays an efficient management controller in Yosemite v3.
social_description: How FB OpenBMC plays an efficient management controller in Yosemite v3.
attendees_expected_learnt: How BMC establishes the most effective management method with the BIC and CPLD in the system will affect the efficiency, stability and even the user's usage habits of the system.

title: Open Aggregation Router for a Converged Mobile Network
description:
The advent of 5G has provided telecoms with new opportunities to foster innovation, reduce costs and simplify their infrastructure using open and disaggregated network solutions. Network disaggregation decouples hardware and software, which can provide telecoms with more flexibility when choosing the solution to fit their needs. 

From within the OCP Telco Project Group, UfiSpace is doing our part to contribute to the development of open and disaggregated solutions for telecom networks. We started with the cell site gateway router, then we introduced our disaggregated open routers for the core and edge networks. 

In this presentation, UfiSpace will introduce the S9600-48X Open Aggregation Router, a part of our multi-function open aggregation solution. We will go into details for the S9600-48X's design, functions, features and potential applications.
social_description: Check out how the UfiSpace open aggregation router can benefit the converged mobile network.
attendees_expected_learnt:
Attendees are expected to learn about:

  • What is Disaggregation and the benefits it brings to the network service provider
  • What is an open aggregation router and the design concept for it
  • Where an open aggregation router would be deployed
  • How to position an open aggregation router in the fronthaul
  • Where to find telecom network solutions from OCP
  • How to join OCP Telco Project Group

title: Challenges and Opportunities of EDSFF based Storage Solution
description: EDSFF SSDs have been widely adopted in hyper-scale data centers due to superior manageability, serviceability, and power/thermal characteristics. However, the adoption of EDSFF in NVMe-oF is non-trivial. For instance, balancing of CPU resource allocation, memory scheduling, and network bandwidth management are challengeable. In this talk we will discuss the challenges and opportunities for adopting EDSFF in NVMe-oF both from hardware and software standpoint. Specifically, we will present two server architectures highly optimized for E1 and E3. In this context, we will present software stack for NVMe-oF solution that enables up to 400GbE performance over TCP network and manages large-scale capacity with low overhead. Finally, we will share the performance measurement methodology for systems equipped with large quantities of EDSFF NVMe SSDs and will share features of test suites which will help explore the potential use cases of NVMe-oF solution.
attendees_expected_learnt: The attendees can learn about the characteristics of the latest EDSFF form factor and its effectiveness. Moreover, we will share two different server architectures highly optimized for EDSFF E1 and E3, respectively. They also can learn about open-source software stack for NVMe-oF and how to integrate with EDSFF based system and its applications.

title: Zion Modular Platform Architecture Overview
description: “Zion” is Meta’s modular AI & ML training platform which is built upon three major subsystems. Each serves a unique purpose, Angels Landing is the multi-socket head-node, Emerald Pools is the accelerator chassis housing 8x OCP Accelerator Modules (OAM), and Clear Creek enables extended IO capability. In this presentation, we will describe how Meta landed on Zion’s modular platform architecture and share its configuration flexibility to support the rapidly evolving AI & ML training ecosystem. Further deep dive into each individual subsystem in aspects such as system design, electrical specifications, connectivity & expansion options and feature support shall be shared.
social_description: Meta Zion Platform for AI workload
attendees_expected_learnt: In this presentation, we will describe how Meta landed on Zion’s modular platform architecture. We will introduce in details about how the three subsystems work together in Zion and how user can reconfig the system for different use cases.

title: An Auto generated test framework for improving SAI interoperability
description: SAI is a critical API for network vendors to drive hardware innovation while preserving investment in a unified software solution across platforms. SAI was open sourced in 2015, and over the years the API has grown in popularity and capabilities. Today, there are over 1500 attributes supported by SAI. The challenge now is to ensure that the intent of those attributes is consistently represented by various implementations. In this presentation we recognize the issue and bring forth an auto generated test framework that will help broaden test coverage for SAI. The proposed changes to the Packet Test framework will help community generate new tests and achieve a goal of getting 100% coverage of all objects and attributes. These changes are foundational to SONiC/SAI gaining broader acceptance and deployment in the industry.
attendees_expected_learnt:
Learn about a new framework to generate a Thrift based RPC server for SAI which can help facilitate programming a SAI based switch and also run test cases.

How to run over 1000 tests using a generic and simple testing mechanism.

title: Circularity - Planning for Carbon Reduction
description:
The computing industry is on track to represent almost 10% of global greenhouse gases by 2025, so more sustainable approaches to system design are critical to consider today. We see a Circular Economy approach to computing as a must-do imperative.
 

How effective is Circular Economy? This talk will first give a wide picture of the circular economy with a focus on server components and their carbon footprint. We introduce Cedaci tool to measure the circular economy for the datacenter industry. Our combined talk showcases the carbon reduction of the circular economy and proposes a tool to deliver it.
social_description: Best Practice Circularity Guide
attendees_expected_learnt: Arm yourselves with the most up to date for making circular decisions and ensuring your products or components are as circular and efficient as possible.

track.name: EW: 2021 Strategic Initiatives
track.description:
This track includes all 2021 Strategic Initiatives.

Sustainability and Test & Validation

There are 2 key work-streams being developed under this Strategic Initiative: Lifecycle of Systems/Components and Metrics. OCP is looking for solutions to support these two work-streams as well as any new relevant technologies that may provide insights for re-usability and assessment of environmental impact.

title: Risk and Reward: How to Mitigate Liquid Cooling Concerns in Advanced Computing Centers
description:
With increasing compute performance there is a corresponding increase in the need for cooling. Air is a poor cooling medium for very high power densities. Liquid cooling can support very high power densities but comes with potential concerns of coolant leakage near sensitive electronic equipment. 

This presentation summarizes the Leak Detection and Intervention whitepaper that was submitted to OCP. We will discuss different leak mitigation, detection, and intervention examples with pros and cons. We will also dive in to the different techniques required for water, glycol, di-electric and refrigerants.
attendees_expected_learnt: In this session you will learn about the different leak detection, mitigation and intervention methods commonly used with advanced cooling solutions. Pros and cons for each solution are provided, as well as a discussion about which solution is appropriate for different types of heat transfer fluids including water, di-electrics and refrigerants. This session is focused on the liquid cooling specifically within the Technology Cooling System (TCS).

track.name: EW: Cooling Environments
track.description: This track is a combo crossover track between Rack and Power (ACS) and Data Center Facilities (ACF).

title: Hyperscale Datacenter Architecture
description: With the advent of “hyperscale” providers, datacenter infrastructure has evolved significantly over the past decade and a half. Most notable are significant improvements in datacenter efficiency (PUE) and a convergence in terms of power distribution architectures. However, the next decade requires three major categories of innovation: (1) Boosting construction productivity through modular design and offsite fabrication (2) Efficiency-neutral cooling solutions using significantly less water (3) Grid stability and optimization in the face of drastically increasing renewables penetration and (4) Securing operations technology (OT) with state of the art cyberdefense. We seek to present challenges and opportunities in these areas of focus.

title: Memory Corrected Error profiling (via Linux EDAC Driver) within large-scale cloud infrastructure
description:
As a result of prior OCP initiative in developing 'Enhanced EDAC driver' to collect fine-granular memory corrected error logs, we can observe and create error profile that was not feasible in the past. It is helping us in making data-driven decision to manage such faults more effectively in our cloud infrastructure.

This presentation consists of two parts: first we plan to share the results of large-scale study of memory corrected errors over past nine-months, then we will share our proposal to extend similar approach to other types of hardware corrected errors, e.g., PCIe, cache, and inter-CPU link errors. This is in line with OCP's OS-first methodology for Hardware corrected error reporting to eliminate dependency on SMI based methods. We will also discuss various mitigation options we are considering managing the impact of such memory corrected errors.
social_description: A case study of the memory corrected error profiling in a large scale cloud deployment
attendees_expected_learnt:
• What are the various types of memory corrected errors observed in a large scale cloud infrastructure
  • Not all memory corrected errors are created equally; some have larger blast radius vs others
  • How can we use this data to make better mitigation decisions and reduce the blast radius
